With Nurse Betty ( 2000 ) , acclaimed indie film-maker Neil LaBute ( In the Company of Men , Your Friends & Neighbors Are Going to Hell ) has done more than just make a movie about an old-timey nurse and her new boyfriend. He's gone and made a movie about love and death, and the way that they affect one another, in a way that no other film I've ever seen has done before or since. For the record, the original Nurse Betty is still alive, but she hasn't done any more films since this one.

In dramatising Wilde's novel, John Osborne has condensed events, eliminated a number of characters, and generally implied rather than shown Dorian's essential wickedness. If you want a more explicit rendering, see the 1945 film. Wilde and Robert Louis Stevenson lived in about the same time frame, but were certainly vastly different men and writers. This story really treats of a theme similar to Stevenson's "Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde", but note that Wilde chose to treat his story as fantasy, whereas RLS took the scientific route.

Based on its current IMDb rating as well as several plot summaries, I didn't expect much from 'Two Hands'. But how wrong I was. From start to finish, you're kept deeply engrossed in a genre which has been continuously unoriginal for quite a while. Even in terms of mise-en-scene and cinematography, the director excels and creates a film consisting of great imagination. If you're looking for a film which is not only entertaining, but also provocative, compelling, and genuinely extraordinary, then make this the next film you watch.

Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits about whether it's rabbit season or duck season. Love Bugs and Daffy stirring up "pronoun trouble" with Daffy always the victim of Elmer's shotgun resulting with his beak always getting dismembered. Then there's the rabbit's cross-dressing that always gets Elmer in his love struck mode. Chuck Jones and Michael Maltese are always favorites of mine in the writer-director team category because of these hilarious hunting trilogy cartoons I've laughed at since I was a kid.

When I was engaged , my fiance and I would frequent the adult bookstores . He would look for his book of the month on the top shelf, while I waited for the last book on the bottom shelf. When we were on a break, he‚Äôd usually grab a book and open it while I sat on the floor, enjoying my time. I have many books on my shelves and I enjoy browsing through them while I‚Äôm waiting. This past summer we were out of town and he wanted me to go with him to a bookstore.

I have to say that this film was excellently produced and tops the ratings as a typical sci fi film! I enjoyed it.. its a sci fi film, if you want a thriller watch another channel.. This is what the scifi lovers want. Excellently produced by one of Sci-fi's best producers Scot Vandiver ! OK the special effects weren't excellent, but what a great cast! Some more money could have been used for effects but then again what sci fi has high budgeted effects. Stop complaining and change the channel if you don't like these type of films..

Just watched Conrack for the first time. Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired, it is a very touching and heartwarming study of a man's evolution to overcome his youth and upbringing in a prejudiced south and a teacher's creativity in connecting with students despite different backgrounds and difficult circumstances. As an educator, seeing a teacher adapt to his students and prepare them for all of the challenges life has to offer, not just the lessons found in textbooks, is a valuable concept of which we all need to be reminded.

Unfortunately , I 've never seen the full version of this movie . I did see the 87-minute version twice , though . In the 87-minute version - which was broadcast on CBC Television as a part of the Movie of the Week series in 1989 - I watched the movie at home . On that first occasion I was able to sit with my wife and our teenage son and my son‚Äôs wife . After the 87-minute version was broadcast we decided to watch the movie at home . As I recall the movie , we were not particularly interested in what we were watching .

`` Americans Next Top Model '' is the best reality show ! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time and I won't say it didn't bother me a little in some areas, but it was great! I love the people who have worked there and the competition is great and they are so nice! This is one of my favorite shows. I don't have a huge collection of things but I have some great deals on clothes that I love. It's pretty amazing to think you can make $150,000 dollars in just a few days.

I did n't personally know Karen Carpenter , nor , Richard for that matter , so I must go by my impression of what he said when he was being interviewed on a television show . I was in a hurry to buy a couple of pairs of shoes , but I didn't have much time , so I could only buy the first pair at a time . The second pair was still on my list , so I decided to save a bit of money on the second pair , and buy a third pair . After I made my purchase , Richard and I decided to go for ice cream .

A classic late 50's film. The superannuated headliners (Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan) are not at their best, but the direction, cinematography, and acting of the younger cast are compelling. In a 50's sense (which I love).The look and feel of the artsy (over-artsy?) contemporary film "Far from heaven" reflects exactly this sort of film (and I suspect this film may be one of the models). A silly plot, of course (hey, it's 1959! ), but as a film-- glorious!

I get really fed up with sitcoms; you feel you always know what is coming so it ceases to be funny. On the other hand, Hi De Hi, you rarely know what is coming and it's laugh out loud funny. I have just purchased the second set of the series, (series 3 -4)and I am surprised at just how much I am enjoying it all - again. I have nothing but praise for the writers or the actors (or the many unseen crew members) because the entertainment they provide is well worth the wait.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes. I saw it listed on the schedule at the Stanford Theatre in Palo Alto, and I vowed I would make the 40 minute drive. The Stanford is an old fashioned movie house that starts each movie with the curtains still shut Yes, they have curtains. They opened as the Fox logo fanfare began to play. When "The Best of Everything" appeared in huge pink letters spread against the New York City skyline, I knew I was right for waiting.I lapped this movie up.

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed. Very funny and the production quality is outstanding. It is easy to see why this short film has been accepted into so many festivals and won awards.Everyone can identify with Calvin having a bad day, bad week, bad life. Travis Davis plays the role superbly! Richard Moll as Tim brings darkness and foreboding that gives this film just the right twistedness. The old man adds to the humor of the story. And who wouldn't love the suicidal goldfish!This short will bring lots of laughs.

Gilmore Girls is one of the funniest , most clever , sharp-witted , sarcastic and heart-warming television shows I 've ever seen . It 's like nothing I 've ever encountered on TV or in movies. . . If it 's not for you , please go away . You won 't be missing anything . Here are the ten things that made me love Gilmore Girls to pieces . 1. The Characters . They just had so much charm and such a great deal of heart that you couldn 't help fall in love with them all . It 's been years since I first watched the pilot episode on TV .

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time . We loved it so much . It was so great to see so many of our own people in the show . And of all the characters on the show. The show is great . It's a shame it ended after a few episodes. If you want to see the original series . You can find it on Netflix and watch it all over again. I will add this link to the list . I recommend this show to all people . I've watched it twice now . Love the show so much.

Our Family and friends enjoyed this movie very much. The theme was well handled by the Director with great performances from Shabana Azmi, Konkana Sen and well supported by good performances from the other cast. The climax was built well but for the ending which was a far from being called "Good". We are still trying to understand what was the Director trying to convey? Were they short of ideas or was the ending beyond the understanding of common movie lovers? A better ending would have created a lasting impression on the audience and increased the viewer-ship.

I saw this movie for the first time a little over a year ago. I've seen it 4 more times since. I had never heard of it before and I consider myself knowledgeable of classic cinema. A true, polished, diamond in the rough.This gem of a movie revolves around Jon Voight (lead character "Conrack") as a young schoolteacher assigned to Yamacraw Island to teach the islands' children, all in one school. At first, the students reveal they know very little of the world beyond their island home.

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am . My brother and I were channel surfing and my brother was really hooked . When I saw the poster, I knew I have to see the movie . I sat up for a while and watched the movie . It was very entertaining . The film was based on true events . The film is called ‚Äú The Silent Force‚Äù . The story is about a secret society called the Illuminati. The members of the society have been meeting secretly for centuries and plotting to take over the world .

Obsessed ! ! ! ! ! I have every season of Gilmore Girls and I think the reason I love it so much is that each episode has it's own twist and turns. It's always different. There is always something exciting and thrilling that happens to the main characters. One of the best episodes, that I love to watch, is "I'm Still Here." I'm going to share with you, my top five favorite episodes from all seasons of Gilmore Girls and my reasons why they are so memorable to me!

Tex Avery's tenure as director of cartoons for MGM was in the 1940s and 50s was one of the brightest moments in cartoon history. His cartoons were exceptionally inventive and surreal with MANY weird touches that were later celebrated in the movie THE MASK. Eyes popping out when a guy sees a girl, impossible stunts and non-stop action were the trademarks of these films.This is one of several Droopy cartoons that Avery was responsible for and it's among his best. Droopy is a Mountie and he is determined to get his man,...though in this case it's a wolf who has escaped from prison.

I would probably not have bothered to comment on this film if I had not been disturbed by the constant use of this word that is used in every single sentence. I was about to watch the movie and my husband came in the room just after I sat down. I looked at him and asked, "What are you doing?" His face was blank. After about a minute he said "We're gonna watch a movie." He turned off the TV and put the movie in the player. He turned it on again.

I like movies that show real people `` Americans '' and tell truth . The movie is simple and that is the best way to make a movie. The movie has good message which I liked very much. It has a great deal of humour too. It is for everyone. I recommend this movie for everyone to see. (0 out of 0 voted)

I liked it

The movie is very good and very funny . It is funny and has a good amount of comedy too. I liked the way they acted . It is very well written.

This was another great episode from season 11 of South Park . Cartman fakes having Tourette syndrome in order to get his way. While he tries to convince people of his condition, he goes to jail because he believes he needs to die to get his message across to the children. The episode starts with him getting an idea while he is talking in class about how people have been talking to him. When he goes home, he tries to make his home look like an ideal environment. The next thing we see is Cartman pretending to suffer from Tourette syndrome in order to gain support in school.

I had no idea who Bruce Haack was before seeing this film. I had just seen the MOOG doc, which was alright, the only problem was Moog led a very content life, and the doc was well... content. Haack's story is filled with all the marketable tragedy people buy into these days, but it carries a great deal of heart with it. Though the film doesn't go into the tragic stuff so much, one can sense that Bruce accepted the price of making music his way. There are so many elements that make up his legacy IE.

John Ford paid the wagons his tribute of a special picture , 'Wagon Master ' made after two big Indian-cavalry charges in which John Ford was the first to take a cannonball in the mouth, which then hit his right eye. He lost the eye and the picture was taken. It was presented to him after he died. He had his picture and his autograph in his wagon after he had his picture and his autograph in his wagon . When he died in 1927 he had a lot of pictures . He is buried in the Hollywood Forever Cemetery.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes . I have not watched it again but did recently. I think this movie is a great example of where we have gotten to in the cinema world. I am glad I was able to stop watching after a couple of minutes. The story of the movie was interesting, the actors are good and I think the plot was original. I will be checking it out again on TCM later this year. There was a good review in MovieFone today.

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare , but Fata Morgana is a good case . You can chalk up the success of Morgana , an animated feature film, to the fact that it doesn‚Äôt take itself seriously at all . Based on the work of German artist and composer Georges B√©n√©zit , Fata Morgana is not a film about science fiction but the story of a beautiful woman going through the motions in her everyday life . This film has already won two Palme d‚ÄôOr , which means it‚Äôs definitely one of the very best films of this year .

Every time I hear Karen Carpenter 's voice , there is that old familiar feeling of 70 's blues . It may have changed in some ways , but Karen Carpenter still has the same sweet tone of an old record in her voice , like on the old songs . On stage she is one of the hardest working vocalist in the current scene . The last few years have been a struggle , because of health problems . I remember when she had the accident of having to have her voice amputated , I remember how that felt , when she had to get her hand cut off .

I had the pleasure to view this film when I was 10 years old,(having an existing interest in Egyptology). I know that there are subtle mistakes to the art direction and costuming, but over all this is the best film, to date with the look of the 18th dynasty.The film only approximates Mika Walteri's "The Egyptian", in plot. A good portion of the text never made it to film, as we have to consider the running length.The music score by B. Hermann and Alfred Newman is beautiful!!! Performances as follows.

Sure , it has its pretentious moments , it plays like art-house , live-action Fantasia , but it also has moments to make you sit down and enjoy the movie , the music is awesome , as you would expect from the director of such awesome movies as The Blair Witch Project , and the special effects are pretty good . If you're a fan of movies that take you to places where you've never been , and show the beauty of the natural world , you should definitely check this film out . The main character , an alien hunter , goes to a remote island that has not seen human contact in a century .

Watching this film caused quite an emotional reaction . This is what today 's documentaries are all about . It's not often you get to watch someone do a back flip and then land on his feet as the audience is cheering him on. It's a really emotional and beautiful moment . I'm not surprised that the documentary was nominated for an Oscar this year and it is a very deserving winner . I think this is going to get some really good reviews . It's certainly a film that deserves your full attention . Saturday, January 29, 2013

A documentary about a man and his family.

Craig Brewer grew up in Tennessee, it is evident in his movie. Forget the Black guy on White Girl action. It happens, but it isn't Samuel L. Jackson on Christina Ricci. More importantly this movie is about the values and culture of the people in this Tennessee town. How they deal with divorce, abandonment, sexual abuse and psychological disorders. While shrinks make millions in the cities of the North, Midwest and West Coast, the town minister, who also grapples with his own problems, becomes the counselor and mediator.

Minor spoilers follow , but nothing you wo n't have learned from reading the back of the DVD.Held together by the simple expedience of holding on to each other by their mutual need to escape and not be devoured, these unlikely couples struggle and bond together as they discover the joys of sharing their lives in ways that the world doesn't know exists. Tales of a Spacefaring Life has been on my shelf for a while. The main reason for this is probably because my partner and I had a few discussions about the books a while back.

During the War for Southern Independence , GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against the Confederate army. We are currently running out of things to talk about here on this site. As of late, people have started to ask me what I‚Äôm doing on this site, why I‚Äôm posting here, etc. This is because I have been making a living off of it for nearly 5 years now. However, since the site started, I have been getting a lot of questions in the comments and I wanted to explain a little bit about the site.

I 'm a fan of independent film . Dialogue driven , character study pieces are where it 's at for me . I love films with real characters , real stories , real emotions . I love to think about them , ponder over what is being said , and then make an educated guess as to what that means . I 'm a fan of many genres . Horror , psychological thriller , action , drama , historical . I'm a film buff . My interests are pretty broad . Tuesday, February 26, 2011

A few weeks ago my friend told me the sad news that he was diagnosed with Stage 3 melanoma.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are `` Blue '' . In the U.S., it's the `` Blue Cross '' and in Canada the `` Blue Cross & Blue Shield '' , in the U.S. and Canada. It's a new term. In Europe and Britain, I have `` blue'' and in Australia, `` blue and white''. But I have seen blue-and-yellow-and-green versions, and a lot of different colors in different parts of the world too. And it makes me think: what are all the other variations?

First of all - I 'm not one to go all sappy over movies . I saw Friends in the theater - and yes I was a little teary a few times. I am a fan of movies, and love the medium. But that being said, when a movie makes me laugh, when I love it I have to share . So please do not judge the film by its title or trailer or anything else . If I can't love it, there's no point in going. So without further ado, my Top 5 films of 2019.

`` The Cell '' is a rather difficult film to classify . If you read the plot outline , `` it's basically a story of the development of a young boy and the effects his illness has on his world. It's a bit more complex in its plot than that description makes it sound . The fact that it doesn't fit neatly into any clear box may be why the film was left out of the Oscar nomination. It's definitely not the best science fiction film of 2001. That honor probably goes to Terminator 2 . The Cell is technically a fantasy film .

honestly .. this show warms my heart , i watch it EVERYDAY on fox family and now that the new season is on my local channel i feel like watching it more, so i can't wait to watch it all over again !! I really don't think I can put into words what i feel watching this show !! Thank you to the show for making me laugh soooo much !! This is the best show on TV right now and it's not because of any special effects, it's just because of how great of a show is.

What can you possibly say ? This is the uncut hardcore , musical Alice ! It works too with a great sense of humour and humour ! This is a film I would not miss if you were lucky enough to get hold of a copy - I don't know how long it would take to come out but you will be able to pick this one out when it comes out ! There are some great laughs and the music is great ! I am a big fan of music videos and these are of the highest quality in my opinion and the video quality is really good too !

Onstage John Osborne 's adaptation of `` Picture of Dorian Gray '' is a fine tribute to Oscar Wilde 's 1891 play that was the subject of an Academy award-winning film in 1954. O'Connor and Wilde were in many ways opposites: The former was dark-haired and dark-complexioned while the latter had a light complexion and a long, full, dark beard. O'Connor was an Irish-born, gay man and the daughter of an Irish mother and an English father. Wilde was also openly gay but he also had a dashing reputation with the ladies. Both of them were well-connected and wealthy and both had an intense desire for social acceptance.

spoiler -- In 1993 , African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City with the follow-up -- New Jack City Strikes Back. In this third installment in the franchise, the titular action hero makes a surprise appearance in South Central Los Angeles in a very familiar guise. It's not that Van Peebles didn't think he could top New Jack City, rather that he was a bit concerned about what type of character he would have next. And in this one, he really was concerned.

Enjoyable film that gives you romance, women-on-the-verge psychodrama, work place sexual harassment, adultery, and fashion. It's all there. Typical characters found in corporate America. Joan Crawford is the usual long time employee bitch executive who feels the need to be such because she's with the big boys. Hope Lange is the entry level ambitious employee whose determined to get to the top by using her mind and not her body. Their personal lives is the subplot. Wardrobe for the film is great but someone forgot to tell Stephen Boyd's hairstylist that "a little dab will do ya!"

Daffy Duck has signs hanging from every inch of every available tree announcing that it 's rabbit season . But the signs do more than tell us this year is the season for rabbits... They tell us it's time for duck season . Daffy was just a baby when Disney made the Ducktales cartoon starring him. Today he is an action hero who, in his own words , ''is not just for kids, he's for everyone'' who wants to become the next big hero . We've been to a Daffy Duck video shoot before, back when Daffy first became a star to the world.

Not knowing a great deal about the Truth and Reconciliation commission, I can only look at this as a piece of entertainment. I started watching it too late in the evening (recorded from BBC2 earlier this year) but once I'd started I had to watch to the end.The down-side is that it's effectively a courtroom drama - never my favourite genre - but it's stunningly photographed (largely in super-saturated ochres) and well acted. Like a good novel, I couldn't put it down. All the way through, I wished I was watching it in a cinema to do the music and photography justice.

Maybe it's just a personal affection for this screen version of the Mika Waltari novel, or a fondness for things Egyptian (I grew up loving to visit the mummies in Boston's Museum of Fine Arts) but I think Maltin is a tad tough on this rather good film. The production values are great regarding color and cinematography, and it appears some effort went into historical authenticity (much of it from the novel, I'm sure). Purdom is admittedly a bit stiff in the lead role, but one can accept this as part of Sinuhe's character.

A good old-fashioned flight-and-revenge western , given a twist and a touch of gravitas by injecting a little black social commentary about racial tensions and racial discrimination . the story follows a young man on his quest to get revenge for his black friend who murdered his white girlfriend's parents in a racist crime . his white friend's father, who was framed by a corrupt cop , turns out to be an even bigger racist . so , as the story starts , we get to hear the man's racist views for himself as he recounts his story .

Susie Q is a great romantic prom Movie. Amy Jo Johnson (Susie Q) is a great Actress. I think she did a great performance. I hope that sometime that the Disney Company could put this movie on DVD. I think it's kind of cool and a little bit hilarious. It's kind of sad when Susie Q dies in a Car accident in the beginning at first it makes you want to cry or sob. But in the middle when no one suspects Susie Q it gets kind of funny and surprising. There is a little bit of mystery in this movie but not much.

Blue Planet... Wow... Where do I begin? The years of hard work paid off in what is, without question, one of the best documentaries ever created.The sights and sounds presented in Blue Planet, like most documentaries with the Attenborough stamp, are rare and haven't even experienced by most people. That alone should be enough reason to buy this series, especially if you're the curious type who 'wants to know'.Blue Planet is not a perfect documentary, however. It does get a bit repetitive after the 3rd episode.

If you overlook the fact that the plot has been done many times, this is a hilarious and gleefully enjoyable Looney Tunes cartoon. The animation is wonderful, the backgrounds so detailed and a lot of audacious colouring too. The writing is razor sharp, and the sight gags especially Daffy constantly getting his head blown off are brilliantly timed. I really did love the arguments between Daffy and Bugs, and that Bugs wins every time. I also love it that Daffy is really greedy and nasty while being uproariously funny. I do prefer him when he's manic but he is great fun here too.

I love this film (dont know why it is called Pot Luck in England - what a rubbish, and entirely irrelevant name! ), I spent 8 months in Barcelona, not as an Erasmus student but living with other foreigners, so it felt just the same. It brings back so many great memories of the fun I had with all the friends I made from different countries, and of the city itself. I really want to see the followup 'Les Poupees Russes ' (the Russian Dolls), I'm guessing it wont be released here?

"Two Hands" is an entertaining, funny story about Australian lowlifes. The screenplay contrasts the world of fast money and deadly acts with the inexplicability of fate and circumstance. In a subtle way we are asked to ponder the concept that major events in our lives are sometimes generated without our being fully aware of the root causes. The forces of fate and circumstance take Jimmy, the main character, into situations that bring about the realization of his shallow dreams and, ultimately, an understanding of a more personally promising world.The clueless Jimmy, portrayed with acumen by Heath Ledger, is a kid who grew up without opportunity.

My girlfriend and I saw this movie when it was originally released. The controversy that surrounded the original release (teen nudity, physical intimacy and unwed pregnancy) were subjects that never touched our view of the film. We were close to the same age as Paul and Michelle and were experiencing many of the same intense and confusing emotions. We were too young to get caught up in the simplistic (at times) acting and the corny (at times) emotional twists. This movie spoke to us in a way that an adult love story never could have.

Every time I hear Karen Carpenter's voice, there is that old familiar feeling of 70's blues. What an overwhelmingly beautiful and mature voice she had. Cynthia Gibb cast in the title role does a good job, however, I thought Karen Allen would have been a better choice. This is a tearjerker movie that does a fine job of presenting the professional careers of Karen and Richard but also the personal struggles that Karen dealt with and her disease. The recording sessions in Herp Albert's studio are very nicely done.

Craig Brewer is now officially a writer/director for whom I will see any film by, no matter how bad it may look. His debut, Hustle and Flow, was one of my favorites from that year, with its emotionally charged storyline and realistic, fallible characters. I wasn't quite sure what I would end up thinking after seeing this sophomore effort. The cast seemed great, the trailer used music effectively, however, it seemed like there was a good chance it would cross into absurdity, and fast. Fortunately, Black Snake Moan hits all its marks dead-on.

This film predates the Australian films Road Warrior and Priscilla of the Desert, and its influence on them is obvious: in the dialogue, locations, photography, direction and political philosophy. The photography is notably confident. The direction is stylish and for the most part well done. If you liked the early Australian films by Bruce Beresford, Peter Weir and George Miller then you'll love "Oz". The direction also reminds this reviewer of Edgar Wright's contemporary work. That similarity suggests that "Oz" was far ahead of its time.

I 'm not usually into dark/psychological thriller type things . However , SEIZING ME is really an amazing piece of work . You can really feel the fear of what you are about to do as you enter into the story , even though you can't really understand what is going on . The atmosphere/setting is so haunting , that I will definitely be looking for this one when it comes out on Blu Ray . The movie will definitely keep me awake at night ! The first time I saw "Seizing the Day" the first thing I noticed is that the director is the same director as in "The Master" .

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

Susie Q. is one of those rare , and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling . It 's not the sex , though that's very enjoyable , and it's not what we all wanted in a horror movie . It's the relationship . This is why this film is called a love story . But don 't think it has only romance , it has some serious drama , too . A young woman named Susie comes back home to find her father dead . She also finds out that her mother had been murdered by her boyfriend .

I have to say that this film was excellently produced and tops the ratings as a typical sci fi film. If you have never seen a space film and are seeking out a good one, check this one out. If you saw it and liked it, I would recommend this one to a friend and they would like it also. It is a little long but not very much. I don't think this film does anything that hasn't been done a thousand times by now, which is why I am glad it is not the last movie on my shelf.

First of all , ignore the comment about how South Park should make fun of Republicans . Everyone is doing their own thing at this point , and it does not matter to me what others are doing . For those who don't quite understand my point , here is the one sentence summary : Republicans are dumb , they don't know how to get elected , and so on . The point remains the same : it's not funny anymore , it doesn't matter to anyone, and so it's not going to change . So here's the one thing that I'm really sick of .

"The Cell" is an exotic masterpiece, a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a serial killer, but also into one of a very talented director. This is conclusive evidence of what can be achieved if human beings unleash their uninhibited imaginations. This is boldness at work, pushing aside thoughts to fall into formulas and cliches and creating something truly magnificent. This is the best movie of the year to date.I've read numerous complaints about this film, anywhere from all style and no substance to poorly cast characters and bad acting. To negatively criticize this film is to miss the point.

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage. I saw "capturing the friedmans" a short while ago and have to admit I thought this was better.The story is not an incredibly shocking one, but it is a great examination of trapped personalities and relational cold war. Block deftly guides the viewer through diaries, family footage and after-the-fact interviews; his interview style is sensitive and probing, and his insights are clear and measured.51 Birch Street is a great examination of personalities and relationships over 40-50 years of social change, the social fallout, and potential for redemption.

Do n't you ever miss the good old days when Disney actually made great movies that really moved you ? The kind of movies that made you believe in magic ? When your whole family sat together in the living room after a night of fun and laughter ? It's hard not to wish Disney had been more like that all along . As it is, there's still Disney movies that aren't that much fun to watch, but at least they're at least worth a couple minutes of your day, and they still make you cry a little bit, and even laugh a little bit.

I have wracked my brain for another film that reminds me of this one . I really ca n't come up with anything . The one I wanted was The Great Train Robbery (1961) where a man gets in a train with only one ticket and he is on the train and he is killed . There is only one other man and that man is going to get out with one ticket . If the story has any truth to it it should have been written in a book and turned into a film . Anyway , I just couldn't come up with a film to compare this one to .

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos's role as Williams for that entire show, was Emmy worthy. It was uncanny how well he did. And to be as rapid-fire and as random and as creative as Robin Williams really is....WOW. There were scenes where Diamantopoulos had to say probably 20 rapid fire lines and do 15 different characters while delivering those lines, all while sounds as much like ROBIN WILLIAMS doing those characters.....well, that my friends is impressive acting. Its one thing to do a Robin Williams impersonation for a couple of minutes.

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare, but Fata Morgana is a good case. You can chalk up the large subject to the ambitions of youth, but Herzog does an amazingly good job. The movie's point is to show human beings, and even the world, from a non-human point of view.The movie is in three parts: Creation, Paradise, and The Golden Age. The imagery of each is in counterpoint to the voice-over. Although the text of `The Creation' (from the Popol Vuh, a Mayan myth) refers to the primordial wasteland, the scene goes no further in illustrating the myth.

Brian ( Wesley Eure ) works for a security firm owned by Mr. Norton ( Conrad Bain ) . The job of protecting the president's office is not a difficult one, but sometimes, when it comes to protecting the president, some people have to be killed. The man responsible is the chief of security himself, Charles Norton. As he and his associates prepare for the president's office to be hit by a nuclear device, the situation gets worse: the president's staff is killed and then the president himself.

This movie is complex and interesting in so many ways. It is a non stop plethora of emotion and taboo subjects. Sex and love. Women's emotional abuse of men, Men's physical abuse of women, Sexual child abuse, Fresh approach to religion in real life, and all tied together with very raw and powerful blues music.I promise you that if you sit through the first 20 minutes you will find the tie in and bettering of all the characters. And the ending will be more pleasant than you can expect.

This game is very good for the n64. You can skate as Tony Hawk, Bob Burnquist, Steve Caballero, Kareem Campell, Eric Koston, Bucky Lasek, Rune Glifberg, Andrew Reynolds, Elissa Steamer, Jamie Thomas, Rodney Mullen, Chad Muska, and maybe some more skaters. The game doesn't have Mike V or Bam Margera. Dang! Well anyway, the gameplay is awesome. The level School II is a great level with so much to skate. In Career mode, you collect SKATE, get money, get high scores and other various things in 2 minutes.

Whoever cast this movie was a genius , every character in it is perfect for their part , and they all did it really well . and if you don't see this , its because it wasnt meant for you , or youre not a good movie person . the thing about the book and the movie is that they are both very good , but the movie is better than the book in nearly every way . i mean , there are some parts where the movie has way more depth , but the movie is also way better and has a better balance of story lines and character development .

The first thing I wanted to do after watching this film was watch it again (because I'd missed lots with all the laughing I did). I'm European and I've studied abroad and I've as good as lived with Spanish, french, Italian and German people. The film was full of stereotypes, which, more often than not, p*** people off, and reading some of the other reviews I see that it did p*** people off. But, this film gets the stereotypes so right I cannot fault it.

This show is my absolute favorite. This show is intelligent, entertaining and always full of surprises. Lauren Graham is perfect as Lorelai Gilmore, a single mother who is Rory's best friend. Alexis Bledel shines as the beautiful and intelligent Rory Gilmore and Keiko Agena is one of a kind as Rory's best friend, Lane Kim. I love the witty dialog, it's what makes it unique about the show. Kelly Bishop is wicked great as Emily Gilmore and Edward Herrman is terrific as Richard Gilmore. Scott Patterson is a joy as Luke Danes and the band members are one of a kind to watch.

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80's on network T.V. I think I was like 9. (Picture seeing a violent horror flick nowadays on regular television). Anyway, I've seen it again years later and it's like I remembered,it's really good,scary flick. I think the reason why it might of gone unnoticed is cause it wasn't followed by a ****load of sequels i.e. Friday the 13th. But it's one of those movies that takes the original idea and does it better.

If there 's one cartoon that helped to put UPA on the map more than any other , It 's probably the A.R. Murugabharan classic , 'Mumbaaiyil'. Murugabharan 's humour, his ability to make everyone and everything relatable, has endeared him to all generations. He has done more for politics than any of the other cartoonists . There 's also a great story behind the cartoon. The story

When he was a young man , Muralidhar was very poor. He had a small patch of land and some money to keep himself fed . He decided to take up a profession that would bring in some revenue .

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south . The story follows a girl who is the daughter of an Indian chief who also happens to be a prostitute and a drug addict. There is a very touching relationship between the main character and his daughter. If you are looking for some good entertainment, then I recommend you to give a watch of Black Snake Moan which is an Indian comedy-drama film based on a novel written by the famous Urdu writer, Muhammad Rasheed. This film is one of the best Indian cinema movies which was made in 2014.

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult. To say that is even an understatement. My sister, brother and I watched it one year at our grandparents' house during Christmas vacation. They had taped it from TV. Our parents were glad it kept us occupied for the one night but they thought we would tire of it and be ready for outdoor activities the next day. Not so! We became mesmerized. They could not have unglued us if they tried. It became a cherished yearly tradition.

Central Airport is the story of a pilot named Jim ( Richard Barthelmess ) who has one bad flight in particular. His life changes after he has his plane blown up. He finds that he can not get the people involved to admit their mistakes or to see the importance of his efforts to save his life. They refuse to help him even after he shows that he is dying. The movie takes place over the span of 4 days. Jim is forced to take a flight to find his wife and daughter. The flight becomes a nightmare due to bad decisions by the characters.

I thought this film was amazing and I laughed so much that I had to see it twice to catch the bits I missed whilst bending over holding my stomach! The critic who reviewed this film for this site challenged anyone with an IQ over their shoe size to find this film funny, well my IQ is approx:135...I challenge this person to question me and then eat his own words! This film is brilliant and if the critic above wasn't such a boring idiot, he might smile for once in his life and take things as lightly as they're meant!!

During the War for Southern Independence, GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against a Yankee invasion.In 1936, Hal Roach decided it was time for his popular OUR GANG kids to branch out into occasional feature-length films. With the big success of Shirley Temple in two Civil War period movies in 1935 (THE LITTLE COLONEL, THE LITTLEST REBEL), it was only natural that Roach would look in that same direction for his GANG. Although given a rather lavish production and distributed by MGM, GENERAL SPANKY was not a critical or box-office success.

After seeing Meredith in `` Beyond the Prairie '' I had to buy another film with her staring . I had seen her movies before, but she had never starred in a movie like this one. And I will be seeing her more than once . I enjoyed it. I have never seen a movie with her before. And I must say that I thought that this was her best movie. The best movie she has made up to now. She is just too good at it. And I must say that she is a great actress . The acting was excellent.

Fuckland is an interesting film . I personally love the Dogma movement . I wish it had lasted longer . I would have enjoyed it , if it was still in the theaters . This is one of the best documentary films of recent times . I had the privilege of watching the film in my local theater . It is a wonderful piece of art . A very thought provoking piece of work . What I found was quite disturbing was the story . It is a true story , that is a bit shocking . It is a true account of what has happened in the mind of a man , who suffered from mental illness .

In Mississippi, the former blues man Lazarus (Samuel L. Jackson) is in crisis, missing his wife that has just left him. He finds the town slut and nymphomaniac Rae (Chritina Ricci) dumped on the road nearby his little farm, drugged, beaten and almost dead. Lazarus brings her home, giving medicine and nursing and nourishing her like a father, keeping her chained to control her heat. When her boyfriend Ronnie (Justin Timberlake) is discharged from the army due to his anxiety issue, he misunderstands the relationship of Lazarus and Rae, and tries to kill him.

I saw this movie when I was a lot younger but it captured me . I loved Orry and George as a young person , but the way I see Orry and the way he acted in the movie made me think he was a little too young . The movie also made me think George was a little too immature . I don't think I would go out and watch it again. I think it is a good movie although it takes a lot of guts to make a movie like this but it is good for a time. Orry is a little different from George .

Personally , I regard `` The Egyptian '' in an extremely favourable light.It was introduced to me by a well-known authority on the East and is certainly the very latest work from a writer who is at once both learned and humane. It is clear and direct. It deals with the problem of the Egyptian as a race in Egypt itself as in other countries in which its influence was felt. In fact, for many years it was felt by many of those concerned that it was the work of this writer which had done the most toward bringing the Egyptians back into touch with the West.

I have watched this show from the beginning , and I am a 45 year old man . To me this show is very attractive , it is very funny , the plot is very simple , it is not complicated , yet very interesting . It has only three characters and they have all their own character. I watched this show as a kid , and now as a young adult , I love it . I really miss the old show , but as I look forward to this new show , so I am very excited .

As Betty Sizemore ( Renee Zellweger ) secretly watches her tyrannical husband Del ( Aaron Eckhart ) being murdered by her jealous ex-husband Gary ( Paul Reiser), she has to get away from her husband, who has finally decided to murder her. Betty and Gary try to flee the house on their motorcycles, but are chased by a police officer who is on her way to capture Gary. When Betty and Gary stop, they are able to escape from the house. They find themselves being pursued by three men on a motorcycle, each in police uniform.

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V . and came across this ad for the C-U-B-N-D. I decided to call them and try to get a better price on my car. When I was on the phone they said to call them back at their office. When I went down I spoke to a lady who was really nice. She talked to me like I was a total jerk and I was embarrassed. It was one thing to talk to a woman on the phone, it was another thing to have to deal with her.

This movie was so cool ! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends . What a good time ! It was really fun to watch , and it was such a nice movie ! I liked all of the characters , and I like all of the movie . All the actors did a fantastic job . I would definitely see it with my friends ! The movie had a good message , and that's what this movie's all about ! I thought it was really good ! I thought the actors did great job . I would definately watch it with my friends again and again.

- A group of bandits rob a train of the gold shipment it is carrying . In their escape , the bandits kill all the policemen on board , and kill the conductor , too. When the train makes it safely back to the railway station , only one policeman survived. The bandits had killed the other one too . The gold shipment that is carried by the train has been insured by the train company for 50,000.000 ( 50 million rupees) . The policeman who survived had taken his chances with the rest and left the train after taking the money.

If this is not my favorite movie of all time, it definitely is in the top five. I love this. Everything about this is perfect--the clothes, the set, the lines--yes, they're not how normal people talk, but... Right down to the small scenes, especially at the beginning of the office girls changing their shoes, picking a wedgie, watering the office ivy plant, putting lunch in the fridge... Identical to what us office girls do today in the year 2005. I think all the minor characters are wonderful.

Yes, this is one of the better done television movies and I wouldn't expect less from Joe Sargent. One thing for this reviewer is that I was also a great fan of The Carpenters, I got to sing all of their material in elementary school and middle school choir and I got to do much of the solo material of which Karen sang lead. I thought she was one of the most wonderful pop singers of the 70's - and being a child/teen singing these songs and learning music - the one thing I was looking forward to was meeting this woman.

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons , Elmer Fudd is out hunting , and Daffy tries to get him some rabbit-meat for the rabbit stew he is cooking. However , Elmer is also out hunting and , when he sees Daffy , Daffy sees him and starts running after him . In the process of running , Elmer gets caught by an angry Bugs Bunny . After Bugs gets through saying a few words of encouragement , Daffy asks Elmer , "Are you looking for the Rabbit , Elmer?" Elmer replies, "I am . But I don't see him .

When this show first came on the air , I saw it once or twice and thought it was another generic cable show , but I did love the look of the show and the characters . It was interesting to see that they made some of the original actors back into the show . I saw it once and was hooked from the start. There was a scene towards the end that I couldn't turn off , so I sat there through it (in my office) until it was over , then came home and watched the whole episode over again .

When I was engaged, my fiance and I would frequent the adult bookstores. He would look for his favorite mags, and on occasion a video that caught the eye. As much as I enjoyed the one-on-one with him that the media caused, there was never a video that I really enjoyed. I had seen only one other movie way back when there was a satellite channel called XXX (it dealt with a private eye unraveling a case) that actually had a proper plot and was enjoyable. All the others were grunting and puffing and blowing and whatnot.

The movie is good and I think Tiffany Amber is very beautiful . I liked the movie . Can anyone else see it ? The movie is nice. I liked a lot of the things that she does in this film. I think I liked her more this time. I love the fact that she gets to wear more of her clothes and that she isn't afraid to wear them or do anything. She really is a pretty woman. Now this movie is a really funny film . A lot of the people who I knew from the comic book series and who I had actually met before in person.

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe . Notice how some of the Roman sets were scaled down a bit. There really was no point in putting them next to the Empire State Building and the Chrysler building. They could not have been scaled up and they couldn‚Äôt have worked in the theater. Also this is the last film to come out in anamorphic 2.35. The new 2.35 aspect ratio will last through the 80mm process in 35mm and then eventually the 2.40 process when we start using the Panavision process.

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts. This one was leaps and bounds ahead of the others in terms of quality of acting, directing, filming and originality of story. It comes together with a professionalism often lacking in short films.This is a great short film for the following reasons: 1. Amazing performances. The 2 actresses are both compelling and believable instantly. Their chemistry is palpable; the depth of their relationship is conveyed, even though the film is 10 mins long. The acting and directing are very powerful.2. Beautifully shot.

I would probably not have bothered to comment on this film if I had not been disturbed by the constant references made to it here in North America as a porn film. Our obsession with what is, or should be, regarded as pornographic remains a relic of the 'guidance' provided to film makers by the Hayes committee many, many years ago and it is now really time that we relegate it to the past. So far we have not progressed far beyond establishing a somewhat arbitrary division between what we now term 'soft' and 'hard' porn, with both carrying the same pornography label.

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot. Bugs of Daffy. He's unsure of what season it is and Bunny and Duck arguing help matters not. Though Bugs proves he's the smartest once more by repeatedly using reverse psychology on Daffy in increasingly subtle ways. And when that runs out he does his trademark cross-dressing thingy. Daffy freaks out and demands the bunny be shot. Though Elmer is too stupid he is hopelessly in love with the girl bunny thing. Elmer really is to blame for all this.

This film, released in 1951, has the usual elements typical of the westerns released during the 50's; the cavalry needing to protect the territory from a murderous band of Indians, an officer determined to see that task through, and the men with him with various character flaws that he has to merge together into a cohesive unit. This small band must hold on to a fort located close to the Indian village until reinforcements arrive. The Indians know, all to well, that the small band is undermanned, and could be wiped out before the help comes.

I could n't believe that the Adult Swim guys came up with this character . I laughed for days just thinking that they made up something on the spot based on what I had said . I think this show is hilarious. I can understand that it's been a while since you watched the show because I'm sure that after seeing it, it will be one of your favorite shows again. The show itself is well written and funny at times. However, the way the characters speak and interact with the other characters is just annoying.

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangements . I think they were trying to capture what you 'd call the essence of the song without the lyrics. They were trying to show how the song sounded in their head. I think you have captured a little of this with the 'dance' and with the 'sickness' part as they both sound the same but the arrangement of the lyrics are different to my ear. As you say in your song, 'songs don't always make you feel sick, they can make you feel beautiful.'

John Ford paid the wagons his tribute of a special picture, 'Wagon Master' made after two big Indian-cavalry epics... It is a lovely poetic movie, full of romanticized reincarnation of the pioneer spirit... It didn't have to top the big ones that had preceded it...Photographically, it is extremely simple... The camera moves only once or twice in the entire film, and never when a director would have made it move to underline a shot... Ford even resists the temptation to track his camera in the breathtaking twilight shots of the women wearily marching along in the dust behind their wagons...

I have been watching King of Queens from the beginning, and have felt it is overlooked at the award shows. This show has the best humor, you can identify with the characters, we talk about it at work a lot, because I work at a company a lot like IPS, (DHL) and we just love the Teamster plugs!! Carrie is my hero, she is the best, she just puts it out there, no matter what the subject is. Arthur well what can you say? He just cracks you up, and really puts a spin on things.

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years , Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries of cinema, genre and narrative style for over thirty years. His most recent projects are his three-part Netflix special Herzog, the Mind of the Mountain (2014), the six part Netflix special Herzog of the South Pacific (2016), and the Netflix mini-series Heart of the Sea (2018). His latest film, a thirty year retrospective Herzog: Reflections on Film and Family, is in theaters now. ‚ÄúI think you‚Äôll be surprised.

One of the best! As being a fan of the civil war, I was very pleased with the first installment of the North and South trilogy. Patrick Swayze gives and extraordinary performance, as well as James Reed and Leslie Ann Down. In watching this fabulous story unfold into a time never forgotten, the subjects of love, passion, grief, shame, harmony, and cruelty come to life. I was first introduced to this series when I was in the eighth grade. Being a young boy, you would think that I wouldn't have been interested in this civil war soap.

The Truth and Reconciliation process in South Africa is a vital and probably unique human experiment . This movie does not shy away from discussing the pain, fear, anger and sorrow of its subject matter. In doing so, the documentary film also reveals the strength of reconciliation and hope for the future of this country which continues to struggle to make the changes needed for the country to move forward. The film explores the aftermath of the 1994 elections in South Africa, the process of reconciliation between different races and religions after a violent campaign of violence and repression in the post-apartheid era.

15 PARK AVENUE is the address "Mithi/Mithali" (Konkona) is in search for from the movies beginning. "Prof.Anu" (Shabhana Azmi)is Mithi's extremely caring and loving half sister from Mithi's mom's earlier marriage. The movie revolves around these characters and looks into the life of a schizophrenic patient (Mithi). The director tries to explain to the viewer the imaginary world of Mithi, through her continuous blabbering to Anu and others. Konkona deserves not one but thousands of awards (which I am sure, she will be getting)for this rendition of Mithi in this movie.

This film had me spellbound this evening . Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted . John Voight , the legendary actor, and his wife are on hand to tell their story . I wish they had stayed on camera for more time . As a result , the film ends up being about 2 hours too short for me . It's just a wonderful story . I hope to see it re-cut to more than 3 hours long so it can be enjoyed for it's full 3 hours and more . This is a wonderful story that I would love to see on the silver screen .

Honestly , when I went to see this movie at the Rave theater in Plainfield Indiana , I did not get the impression that the main character was mentally retarded . I thought he was really smart and capable of handling whatever the situation put before him . But that did not stop my family from telling me I was acting like my character in a movie . My father kept saying , "You see , when I was in school , we would never say anything like that to each other . And my mother would tell us that she did not like him .

Alright so this episode makes fun of Al Gore . I 'm sure it pisses a few liberals off . I also think it makes a great show. We get to go to a climate conference . There are several panels. One of the panels talks about the need to act on climate . One of the panelists gets to go on stage . She says that if we really want to tackle climate change we need to use the carbon credits . We don't have a way of storing all the carbon we put into the atmosphere and it would be too easy to just put it into the atmosphere .

I'd honestly give this movie a solid 7.5, but I clicked 10 to try to offset the 5 pages of imbecilic, unjustified 1-star reviews. This is an interesting story, all of the acting is good to very good (even Ms. Diaz, who is totally out of her usual grinning-bimbo role here, yet plays it well.) The sets are perfect and the cinematography is consistently appropriately creepy. It's a fine morality play and there is *no* reason to explain the origin of the god/supernatural being/alien/whatever that's "running the show," so I'm glad the movie doesn't try.

I was drawn to "Friends" by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous Elton John whom I had see in a club in nearby Houston. I had no idea of the emotions and impact the movie would make. Recently I was brought back to the movie by a song that Heart did called "Seasons", then I found the Elton John song "Friends" thinking it was the same song...it's been 35 years of so. Anyway, the flood of the emotions of "Friends" came back like seeing an old photograph of your first real love.

(My Synopsis) Rae (Christina Ricci) was a high school slut and nymphomaniac who connects with Ronnie (Justin Timberlake) to fulfill her needs. Ronnie must report to his National Guard unit and leaves Rae all alone. Rae is not alone for long, because she is the town tramp with a powerful need to hook-up with a man. After a party, Rae is taken home by a friend who ends up beating her half to death and throws her on the side of the road. The next day, Lazarus (Samuel L. Jackson) finds Rae and carries her home.

Although dated, this film is definitely worth a watch. I saw it about eight times as a teenager when it opened and it changed my life...I just HAD to live in New York. It has great opening shots of the Manhattan skyline with Johnny Mathis crooning "Romance is still...the best of everything..." that rival those of West Side Story. There is a rather stilted performance by the world's REAL first Supermodel, Suzy Parker (sorry about that, Janice D.), but it's great eye-candy!

I watched this movie at the first showing available in my area , and it was quite clear that most of the viewers were very upset by the film and the violence , especially the violence against men. The film was very violent , and the message was not that women are bad , as the title would make you think . The film is an excellent example of psychological violence , and the main character does not get the justice she deserves . I could not watch the movie , I am ashamed of what I did to it .

I am a history teacher and overall I was pleased with the movie . My teen-agers enjoyed it over the weekend and said they enjoyed the history lesson and that they learned more about our past in it. I am not a fan of historicals, but I do love to educate my students on history and so I really enjoyed this one . . . I am a big history buff, but have not seen it all. That being said, this was a great film and I will recommend it to any teacher and the students who would enjoy it as well!

I really like this show. It has drama, romance, and comedy all rolled into one. I am 28 and I am a married mother, so I can identify both with Lorelei's and Rory's experiences in the show. I have been watching mostly the repeats on the Family Channel lately, so I am not up-to-date on what is going on now. I think females would like this show more than males, but I know some men out there would enjoy it! I really like that is an hour long and not a half hour, as th hour seems to fly by when I am watching it!

Just Before Dawn came out during the golden days of the slasher film . The backwoods slasher pretty much started as a franchise, but the success of the original "Friday the 13th" made them a huge hit, and so the slasher film industry started to grow up around these films. While many of the films and even the sequels, such as "Chill of the Nights" and "Night of the Demons" (both made in 1978), have been released over the decades, the original made it all the way to #10 on AFI's 100 greatest horror films .

One of the best ! As being a fan of the civil war , I was very pleased with the movie, it‚Äôs story and characters . But, the acting was a little disappointing for me, I would have have preferred that the actors were not in the roles of the characters they portray . I think that they did a great job , as they did their jobs very well. I would say that if you‚Äôre in search of a great historical fiction film, watch this one ! I would say this is a great movie for those who like historical fiction !

My wife and I saw this when we were 17. The only good thing my father ever did (get us in). This is "our movie" and the music is "our songs". Michelle's song is "our" song. Yeah, nowadays, it's a crime to show naked children on the screen, but we were screwing at 16, why not these kids? The movie is- rich boy impregnates poor girl, then rich dad steals him away from her at the end, after she gives birth under impoverished conditions. She is left alone with child.

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew , a narrative depth superior to most novels , wonderful music, and a new look that brings this much loved classic to life. This is one of those rare films that has been adapted for television and yet transcends the medium. It is not so much an adaptation of The Lion King as an extension of it. The story of Simba, played by newcomer Seth MacFarlane, is so engrossing that you feel as if you have been there watching him grow and learn. It is a magical film, full of love, humor, and heart.

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons, Elmer Fudd is out hunting, and Daffy tries to get him to shoot Bugs. Needless to say, Bugs has his own agenda. Moreover, "Rabbit Seasoning" makes interesting use of word order and pronouns (warning: it just might hilariously and royally mess up your speech).I think that probably my favorite aspect of this cartoon is the costumes worn by Bugs and Daffy. One of them seems like it would have been risqu√© for 1952 (especially in a cartoon), but they pull it off perfectly, as they always did.

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking. I'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and challenged. Great acting, directing - and it is Canadian to boot! It is a film that families can enjoy and serious movie lovers. The locations in Ontario evoked such a sense of nostalgia for the era. With so much garbage and superficial hype selling these days it is great to see that someone could back an independent flick. For any family that has risen to overcome a challenge or an obstacle - be it financial or illness - this film strikes a resounding chord!

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult . To say that is even an understatement . There's not enough words for the experience . The movie is about a boy who goes with his grandfather to see his family . And there's this girl that lives in the house he goes to see. The boy wants to play with this girl so badly but her mother says no . So after a little bit of arguing the boy runs into the woods and runs up to the top of a hill . There he finds this little girl and plays with her .

This is what porn used to be, this is a true classic. I mean, it is an x-rated musical based on an actual book! There is a real plot to it and how many x-rated movies can boast that these days? This belongs in an exclusive short-list of true pornographic movie classics, including Debby Does Dallas, Deep Throat, and Behind the Green Door. I think the problem with "pornographic movies" these days is that it's all about the "pornographic" and not about the "movie".

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. What a Surprise!!! The movie was awesome. It was true love is all about. The characters (Paul and Michelle) had no luxuries, no money, and sometimes no food, yet they were still happy. I recommended this film to all my friends, but they all critized my tastes, and even called me names, becuase the movie featured two minors naked.

The year 1950 saw two very different and interesting westerns: 'The Gunfighter' by Henry King, and 'Wagon Master' by John Ford. 'The Gunfighter' was historically notable as it clearly influenced Zimmerman's 'High Noon' (1951) and later revisionist westerns.However, I personally find 'Wagon Master' superior to it's contemporary counterpart. Ford's minor masterpiece isn't much about storytelling; it should be conceived more as a poem describing conceptions of old west. Although optimistic and warm at heart, we are deserved from naivety because it's completely free from pretentious underscoring.

I saw this movie for the first time a little over a year ago . I 've seen it 4 or 5 more times since then . It is a film that is worth seeing in its entirety for the performances in all of it . It doesn 't seem like it should be too much of a surprise to say that one of the characters in the film would be my favorite . I don't know that I could ever say what I like about any other character in this film but I 've seen this movie so many times that I should be able to say what I like about any character at this point .

Jordan takes us into the seedy crime side of Sydney , Australia , following the desperate attempt of nineteen year old Kaleena , who is about to marry her much older boyfriend and her mother's new best friend , to track down and rescue the missing daughter of a notorious drug dealer. Written by
Anonymous
Date: 27th September 2003

Beware the Beast
A dark comedy from one of the great Australian film directors of the twentieth century , Michael G. Wilson (
The Killing Fields ,
The Castle of Fu Manchung)
In
Beware the Beast we watch a young couple on the run from the authorities.

"Boy Next Door" is a hilarious romp through male neurosis. In just over fifteen minutes, the film takes us on a journey that most full-length features can't even match. Great performances, excellent camera work and editing---this short is a classic from start to finish. Kudos to Travis Davis for pulling double duty as both director and star. He's the funniest nebbish since Woody Allen. And what a treat to see Richard Moll back again. If you thought all he could do was play "Bull" the bailiff on "Night Court", think again.

this is a really great series. i love the show and i am so glad it isn't canceled yet. it has really good humor and shows the realistic bond between a young mother and her daughter. o yes for Gilmore girls! it is very awesome. they are such a sarcastic humorous bunch. they do everything together just like my mom and me. ya for Gilmore girls. um, i'm running out of lines. but i love how Luke and Lorelei's relationship is finally shaping up. they so needed to be together. and i absolutely just love Sookie St. James!

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title . It draws parallels between the attitudes, customs, and social practices of different parts of America, as reflected by their movie stars. It‚Äôs a movie about American movies , but not really about American movies . Instead of talking about Hollywood blockbusters or American directors, it talks about the real life movies of various types of films, that are produced all over America. The movie starts off with interviews with famous filmmakers , discussing their personal experiences on working in America , and also about the films that inspired them .

Pat Conroy's autobiographical book "The Water Is Wide" proves to be something of a Southern "Up The Down Staircase", yet despite the teacher-going-against-the-odds formula, "Conrack" really does move the audience with each little breakthrough and creative flash. These students (uneducated black kids on an island off South Carolina) are actually shown learning, and their collective wide-eyed innocence is remarkably sweet. The one actual actress in the bunch (Tina Andrews, an amazing performer) plays the "tough nut" Conrack has to crack, and once she falls under his charms, it all seems a breeze.

My kids loved this movie. we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie. we watched it as a family and everyone of us enjoyed it. it was a movie you could watch without any uncomfortable spots that you would have to explain to the younger ones. my boys loved this movie and they would love to be able to see it again. even after all these years they remember it. that Amy Jo Johnson was a very cute girl. all my boys had crushes on her. they loved her as the pink power ranger which is why we watched this movie to begin with.

This second full-length Lone Ranger feature does n't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with a strong cast and excellent supporting work. But as with all good comic book movies the best scenes are when the story and dialogue are put together well, and the acting is excellent. It's not just a film about the Lone Ranger and his horse but a Western about two brothers fighting for the honor of their family. In the second half, you'll also see a side of the Lone Ranger he has not seen before.

` 5 Years ago if you were to watch an Australian film you would expect to see crocodile hunters , but no one would be surprised by a story of a man with a cane who has lost all of his possessions and is forced to wander the bush looking for food, when suddenly he is offered a piece of land by a woman who is about to be eaten alive by a crocodile. He accepts and takes on the woman‚Äôs two young children and she feeds them, and the crocodile decides it is not hungry.

This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made..... Realistic. Movies were not candy coated during the late 60s and early 70s. The producers did not try to create some happy ending that didn't exist. The lack of a happy ending would create agitation in the audience that, hopefully would spur them on to action. At least that's how it seemed at the time. In today's movie world this movie would probably not be done. There would, definitely, not be this ending, however realistic.

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if the story is realistic. It is so much fun for me to write about the characters‚Äô interactions. In addition to writing stories for my own enjoyment, I now have quite a few writing groups, where I do not only read and read and read again, but also contribute my writing. I‚Äôve read some great authors‚Äô writing and learned so much and am now trying to create some new stories too.

For my money, probably the best film - or at least the most purely cinematic film - director Ford ever made. The dialog is swift, clipped, to the point.l The story starts at the very beginning and only ends with the final credits. Ford uses a relatively small cast, but directs them and photographs them with a verve and a sweep of epic proportions. Grimly realistic, warmly amusing, brilliantly acted (hard to believe Johnsonj couldn't become a leading man after this), with the best photography and editing in any American black-and-white film.

Fata Morgana , the 1971 documentary-like film by German filmmaker extraordinaire Werner Herzog , filmed over several years in the Canary islands of the southern tip of Africa , is one of his most beautiful and harrowing movies. It is also among his most enigmatic. For those unfamiliar with the film, it is based on the real-life case of the ‚ÄúTWA 7,‚Äù the doomed German airliner which ran into a storm and crashed into a mountain on January 20, 1937, with the loss of all on board. Herzog was inspired by the passengers of TWA 7 as they waited on a ledge for rescue to arrive.

I haven't seen a film in a long time that moved me and gripped me in such a way; that I couldn't take my eyes off the screen. I was busting for the loo; and I didn't even want to pause it because I was drawn right in. Emotive; powerful; very moving; horrific and heart-breaking. It gives you an amazing insight to South Africa; their struggles and their lives. The acting by the leads were mind-blowing and the script was incredible. Despite the terrible events that unfold in this film and how horrific the story is; I was captivated.

One of the biggest French success of the year 2002, "l'auberge espagnole" was also very well greeted abroad which is quite extraordinary for a French film. *spoiler* *spoilers* *spoilers* I found the film amusing.It was weird and I enjoy it,I laughed a lot so the bottom line is that I recommend the film.However I have problems with what LaBute wanted to say.The plot is very simple.Betty(Renee Zellweger), a hard life house wife watch her husband being murdered and while having forgotten everything she had seen,she follow her "true love" for a soap series character,Dr. David Ravell (Greg Kinnear). This if the first movie I 've given a 10 to in years . Don't you ever miss the good old days when Disney actually made great movies that really moved you? Growing up with Disney I always found myself being captivated by the characters. This was on odd film . I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children . The story was good but I would have preferred a slightly better animated story . "Americans Next Top Model" is the best reality show! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time watching it.I kept my eyes open the entire time. One of the most pleasurable aspects of movie viewing is to get lost in a film . To have it all, the plot twists, the surprises, and the sudden revelations, all wrapped up together in a single movie. It has been a tradition in film that is well over 50 years old. Movies have always played a big part in how society views people. Whether it is how society views criminals or how society views gay men or transgender men, we have always known that the movies have had a tremendous influence. There is no denying that without movies, our history might have been different.

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites . The unsung hero of his generation . Nobody knew him or his films or even his life. He was simply the greatest and most beautiful director of his era . I don't think I'll ever meet anyone who was as good and as beautiful in his own way . And his movies are as beautiful to my eyes as the ones I love . So it is a privilege to have this great man with us at this event . The only way it is possible.

This Aussie flick filmed in 1999 does an OK job of portraying a bunch of small-time crooks in Kings Cross, Sydney. The plot focuses on the plight of a young would-be crim who's life is in danger after botching a job for his future boss. Very well acted by Heath Ledger and Bryan Brown. When one crim is searching for bullets for his gun.

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much. This is one of the best period pieces on the Civil War that I have seen that tells a story of friendship divided by the war. The costumes are great, the story lines are great, I love how the story jumps around from character to character to keep you guessing as to what's going to happen next in their lives. There is a great balance of good and evil. Some of the characters that are evil in my opinion are too good not to watch.

I am a history teacher and overall I was pleased with the movie. My teen-agers enjoyed it over the holidays. Is it 100% accurate and is it a little sappy in places? Renee Zellweger is Betty , a Kansas waitress who wants to be a nurse , who is infatuated with a wealthy widower named Paul (Kevin Costner) , but Paul is married and can‚Äôt marry her unless he divorces his ex-wife Margaret (Cameron Diaz), who has a daughter. I viewed The Reader at Sugar , which is not an optimal venue for viewing anything , and the movie is not particularly good either , but it's the first movie i saw on the new dvd player in my room . I'm a fan of independent film. Dialogue driven, character study pieces are where it's at for me. Some of the other posts are right: "Wannabes" isn't going to rival "The Godfather" for best mob film ever. On the other hand, "Wannabes" is a well-written and well-directed picture that has surprisingly good performances from every actor/actress.
