The Gilmore girls is about a mother who had a daughter when she was 16 . Now the daughter is 14 years older than her mother and she can't stand it. They go on a date and after the date her mother asks her how she felt about her date. The girl replies that she liked him because she didn't care for him. Now the mom feels bad and asks her daughter to get her a book that talks about how to deal with a younger man and what you should do to be successful in your life.

`` Jaded '' should not be considered as en erotic thriller because the sex scenes are not for viewing pleasure only; it is a psychological thriller. It is also about the search for meaning, which could not be better illustrated by the film‚Äôs title. It is a tribute to those who have sacrificed, and there is no better example of a hero who sacrifices his own self-interest and desires in order to do what he believes in. It is a wonderful tale of heroism, and if you have not seen the film you should get a copy, it is a true classic of a time long gone.

Me and my roommate got free tickets for a Pre Screening I guess you would call it in Atlanta, GA at Atlantic Station. Walking in I was expecting something controversial, provocative, unnecessarily overdone, etc.. But the film is much more than that. It's a story of two people helping each other. Thats the beauty of it.

Well , okay , maybe not perfect , but it was pretty close . This movie jumped from crime drama to thriller with aplomb . I was completely swept away from the film and had to watch it over and over . Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits. Contents

Seasonings can be obtained by talking with a character who has already obtained seasoning in an area, by speaking the name of the character (except in The Great Escape) and by speaking the name of a character that has already used seasoning in an area. Talk with the characters who have already used seasoning to get Seasoning, but remember that they can still use the seasoning as soon as they get the seasoning, just like all the characters who have not yet used seasoning yet can.

Central Airport is the story of a pilot named Jim (Richard Barthelmess) who has one bad flight in over 4000 hours and is forced to give up commercial flying. He meets a beautiful girl named Jill (Sally Eilers) and the two start up an act involving flying and stunts. The two start a relationship, but when Jim is hurt, his brother (Tom Brown) takes over the act for a while and falls for his brother's girlfriend. I saw Two Hands back in Sydney a few years ago and it instantly became one of my all-time favourite films. I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college . As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to vamp, I pondered on my life, wondering why I had chosen this life. I knew the reasons for it were good and valid. It would make a nice career and help my family and provide me with the things I would need in life. I was pretty confident of this. However, this film made me doubt myself. While my reasons for choosing a life like that may be valid, I don‚Äôt think it is possible for anyone to be 100% sure of their choices.

In the midst of a documentary about his parents , the filmmaker 's mother dies , but he continues making documentaries. The director is left to ponder what's really happening, and he decides to make a documentary about his family . The film is called "The Manchurian Candidate " (the movie is a play on the film of the same name, which was directed by Terence Malick) . As the film opens , the director is at a loss , with the help of his son . The film was released on February 8, 2013. It was met with mostly positive reviews .

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen . To explain my experience , let me first state that I love to write. I find it very stimulating and cathartic , not just for myself, but also for those whom I read it. I also love watching films. Films are a very powerful medium, that allow the viewer to become immersed in the plot and the characters of the film. When a viewer finds something interesting and unique, he has to express it with his own words, in his own voice. When you make a film, you must feel it.

I love to see a female protagonist, in this movie her name was Rose. Rose brought out a lot of interesting questions in her journey of fulfillment.Is is possible to attain peace and internal fulfillment through external means? Does our society teach this? Can one be a victim of memory which may lead to victimizing others? Is one responsible for being a product of one's environment? To what extent can one control or take control of one's environment? How is a "typical" human alike or different than Rose? Lastly, would the outcome or story change if it were from another country like France or Italy?

What can I say? You expect only the best in drama from the BBC and MESSIAH is not an exception to the rule.MESSIAH is a great thriller, a truly shocking and creepy tale about a serial killer who cuts out victims' tongues and replaces them with silver spoons. Police Officer Red Metcalfe (Ken Stott) and his team have the task of trying to solve the mystery of the seemingly random events, before more lives are lost.But be warned - despite it's '15' rating (in the UK), MESSIAH is a bit of a gruesome film.

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school football game. When he meets and falls for an attractive local girl she helps him realize he has a shot at a 'full ride' scholarship if he plays well.All too often, these dramas fall into formulaic traps and tell the same old story of a troubled and confused teen. FULL RIDE's Matt Sabo certainly fits this profile, but below the surface is a much more unique individual than we usually see in this genre.

The Killing Yard is a great film , although uneven at times . Morris Chestnut puts forth a phenomenal effort in his performance , as a man who has dedicated his life to a pastime he considers an addiction , but is forced to put it aside when he encounters the one thing that could bring him peace of mind and solace in life , a girl . But Chestnut‚Äôs life comes to a stand still , when he learns the truth behind the story he has been forced to abandon , and he is forced to go on a quest to find her , and he does find her , and they fall in love .

I caught this as part of the Cartoon Noir package at the Clinton Street Theater in Portland , and it was really fun to watch. It's also one of a handful of animation films of the day to show up in my list of the "Top 50 Animated Films of 1994", and there are few animated films that stand up in my book as a real stand up, and it's a good thing I liked it because it was one of my all time favorites of the year so far. I 'm astounded and dismayed by the number of reviewers on this site who did not get the point of my review. It is not my goal to get the reader to feel compelled to buy more books; it is my job to give a critical assessment of the books reviewed and to recommend the best. If you cannot accept that there is a huge difference between a "novelization" and an adaptation, or that there is a wide disparity between a good novelization and an adaptation, then this review is an exercise in futility.

My favorite film this year. Great characters and plot, and the direction and editing was smooth, visually beautiful, and interesting. Set in Barcelona, the film follows a year in the lives of six foreign graduate students and assorted others. Cultures and languages clash but hearts and lives intertwine. The leading role would never have been cast in Hollywood, but he carried the part perfectly. The characters were nicely developed and their interplay was honest and accurate. There were two especially noteworthy scenes, the climax was truly inspired.

I can't help but notice the negative reviews this movie has gotten. To be honest, I saw the preview for this movie, and the premise looked intrigued me. Yes, I rented it after reading others' comments. They are correct in that some of the acting leaves a lot to be desired. They are also correct that one of the best performances of this movie was that of Dr. Graves.Also interesting is Scott Clark, who plays Grant, the kid in the wheelchair. I identify with the character he played, perhaps because I am in a wheelchair.This movie is certainly worth your looking at.

I didn't personally know Karen Carpenter, nor, Richard for that matter, so I must go by how the movie portrayed her. I think a better person to ask about it's accuracy would be her brother Richard. I saw "The Reader" at a film festival in Manhattan this week. It touched my heart in a way that few short films have done. These are genuinely interesting characters, and their story is told in the perfect length of time. This is no small feat.

Please be aware that this film has nothing to do with the Radio City Music Hall! As an archivist re: the Music Hall..I know what is and what is not associated with the New York venue. There 's a unique place in the pantheon of John Ford films for Wagonmaster , Sergeant Rutledge , and The Iron Horse . "The Horse That Dances Like No Horse" is a story of two horses, one wild and free, one tame and tame-like. There is a scene in The Horse Who Danced Like No Horse where the horses are separated. The wild horse runs and the tame horse stands and waits for his master to return. We see the horse's eyes and ears for the first time: They are small, almost like the eyes of a fox.

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years . Great production design , appealing stars , music , excellent costumes . We follow Betty as she struggles with depression, anger, and paranoia. And as she gets closer and closer to her son, her fears grow.

I saw this movie with my girlfriends and we all loved it ! It is so sweet and heartwarming , and it will definitely keep you coming back for more. Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award. And I have to say, it was well deserved because Boy Next Door is a very funny short film! I have been a "huge" rush fan ever since "moving pictures" and this concert is simply and example to everyone who is a fan why Rush is so popular. The hurried approach that Lewis Seiler takes with King of the Underworld establishes a deeper plot , while still maintaining the same tone, that was established by King Arthur, which is similar to the novel's opening scene in which Arthur arrives at Camelot after having been on the run for several years, and he has a conversation with Lancelot about their shared history, before King Arthur is struck down and killed. In fact, the scene at the end of King of the Underworld is so similar to King Arthur that it is sometimes labeled as the "prequel" of Arthur's story.

what was the quote by archbishop tutu at the end of the film about a person 's past ? this seems like an interesting question since the film opens with a scene of Tutu asking if anyone would want to talk about their past. the question is not asked as a statement but as a suggestion that they would like to discuss their past in the light of our current life. this makes the question a little different than a statement question which is usually used to test the knowledge of a person. it is more of a question to which the person feels the urge to respond.

Usually, Alan Alda plays characters that are too "soft" and overly verbal -- it's probably how he really lives. This time, he fits the character. This second full-length Lone Ranger feature doesn't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with enough rough and tumble action and moves along at a good clip. The Ranger looks into a series of mysterious murders which have a sinister pattern to them with peaceful Indians being the victims of a gang of hooded killers. There are more killings and violence usually associated with Lone Ranger adventures and the film has an undercurrent of racial insensitivity, the comments of which are sprinkled throughout the screenplay. The Ranger uses disguises as only he can to piece together clues and expose the outlaw band and bring them to justice.

Where this movies differs from traditional Hollywood movie is that it shows a true depth of feelings. In Europe for example we've had years of war and though one nation could never eradicate the other, the old enemies always ended living next to each other or WITH each other at the end of the conflict. In the US, the immigrants white population exterminated the aboriginal population to near extinction. the US citizen never had to live with its enemy. This explains in my view the often simplistic nature of Hollywood movie when they try and explain a foreign country's strife.

Police officer Dirk Hendricks (Jamie Bartlett) files an amnesty application Alex Mpondo (Chiwetel Ejiofor).A member of the South African Parliament who cant remember the torture he once endured as a captive political activist.South African born attorney Sarah Barcant (Hilary Swank), meanwhile, returns to her homeland to represent Mpondo.As well as Steve Sizela, Mpondo's friend who was arrested along with him, and never heard from again.This film is one of the best films to come out about the South African regime of Aparthied, in the past.Everybody should watch it.

I was drawn to `` Friends '' by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous music producer. My first impression was not very favorable, but listening to the album made me realize the album was very good indeed and that was what made me change my initial thought. It is still a very enjoyable album and that's a good sign. I am really happy to get to this point where I could finally say I like it. For one thing, you can't say that the music is bad.

Adult version of the classic Lewis Carroll tale is much better than you might expect . Here Alice is a little girl who, in an attempt to help her brothers, finds a book entitled "The Mad Tea Party" . When she finds the book she reads a chapter, and after reading it she goes to find the Mad Tea Party. There she finds the Mad Tea Party. It is an old story about a man, and a tea party , with a cat. So the first chapter is told in a child's language.

I actually went to see this movie with low expectations since it was the only one that fit my schedule for the week. The story line was pretty good and I enjoyed the actors who played the main characters. Unfortunately, some parts were predictable and didn't flow well. Still, this is one of the better movies of 2008 and I am happy it got a release. My only major complaint about it is the pacing. There were a couple of times I thought "this isn't going anywhere" and the pace was so slow I could barely keep up with the story.

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through. It has a great ensemble of characters, an origional plot, and an ending I shoulda seen coming but didn't and pulls at your heart strings.If theres any one thing about this movie that got me the most it was Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock's interaction. These two are great and it warms my heart to see Rock isn't going to do crappy Big Hollywood fare like Lethal Weapon 4 for the rest of his life. Freeman is as always the man, really there shouldnt be any need to critique his work anymore.

i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store at the beach and i remembered this movie because at the movie theatre i saw the same poster and at first i thought this film would be similar but when i watched the movie i realized that what they were trying to do was to take a different path in their life and they did and now it's a wonderful story. the characters in the movie were well written and in a very funny way. i was laughing so much at the beginning and then i had to hold my tears until the end.

This is definitely an excellent show. I don't have cable, so I started renting them, because my friend recommended it. I had always heard about this great mini-series, but viewed it for the first time this week, July of 2007. I can see why it started the careers of so many young actors. The story is intriguing and gives wonderful insights into the period before and during the Civil War. I cared about the characters and how their lives evolved during this period. Some of them were stereotypes, but they still helped me see how people thought during the 1800's. Many historical facts were thrown into the story and it was interesting to see history books come to life.

Forget about the plot of this movie. Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn and Vincend D'Onofrio. Forget about the fact that it is one of the few movies starring Jennifer Lopez that I can stomach. Although the story made be impossible to believe and much of the dialogue seems contrived, the one and only important thing to remember when contemplating watching this movie is that it contains some of the most amazing and disturbing imagery ever put on film. It is as if Salvador Dali decided to make a crime drama.

I had no expectations when I started to watch this movie. How surprised I was! This is a great, beautiful, twisted movie which will give your mind a good work-out! It's not simple. If you only enjoy Police Academy style, no-brains movies, this is not for you. The Cell is a deep, complex film with influences from movies like Cube, Silence of the Lambs and The Lawnmower Man, along with lots of completely new ideas. Wonderful, twisted environments, good acting and a compelling story makes this one of the best films I have seen in a long time!

The film begins with a cranky old Broadway producer ( exceptionally well-played by veteran character actor Richard Carle ) being asked by his daughter to make a movie review of a Broadway play (which he is reviewing himself) while the cast and crew prepare for opening night. After the old man's daughter wins a competition to go on the show, we get to know the cast and crew in a few minutes and see the first performance. We then meet the producer's son, played by Tom Conti in a fine performance. The old man gets a phone call and finds out he has won his prize.

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values , but very surface-level storytelling . I would go further to say the characters are very shallow and flat. It‚Äôs not a great film for those with an aversion to violent content . It‚Äôs a fun watch for the most part and if you have some disposable income and like your films to appeal to all demographics this is a good film for you . 15 Park Avenue, well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in Kolkata. In a way she makes us realize that probably each one of us is looking for our own '15 Park Avenue'.

Wagon Master is a very unique film amongst John Ford's work. Mainly because it's the only one that is based on a story written by John Ford himself, the story that was elaborated by Frank Nugent and director's son ¬ñ Patrick Ford and turned into a screenplay, and because of director's personal opinion regarding it, Wagon Master is the film John Ford called the one which `came closest to being what I had wanted to achieve', to say so is not to say a little, but as Ford confessed once to Lindsay Anderson, his favourite was nonetheless My Darling Clementine and not any other.

This one started excellently . The photography and audio are the best I 've experienced in years ( okay , not years , but months ) . The plot is fantastic . I loved it. There are several other movies of this genre that have come out this year , I think , but none in the same quality, and none that were as fun as this one .

The `` Hunting Trilogy '' of Rabbit Fire ( 1951 ) , Rabbit Seasoning ( 1952 ) , and Duck Seasoning ( 1957 ) is regarded as the quintessential collection of short films for children of the Great Depression era in the USA. These four films are set in the fictitious town of '' Rabbit ' s Hole '' , a place where all children are free to develop their individual talents, but must watch and learn from the older children. They are directed by the prolific film director and director of photography, William Cameron Menzies.

America 's Next Top Model is a great reality show in every sense . It has a great hostess , an entertaining host , a great team of producers and cameramen , a great make up artist , a great fashion model and a great judge who can give the best answer for any kind of question . And then the best thing is to watch it from the comfort of your home without any need to travel to any exotic location . I watched this show from its beginning when I was a young man and then later when I came back to India when I had an opportunity to watch it.

My taste in films continues to astound me and probably infuriate readers of my reviews but to each their own. Some of you may have a favorite, but I will give you mine. To start my list out with the best in the genre‚Äôs of horror, I‚Äôd like to give you my top three picks. I‚Äôm going to go out of my way to discuss each film, why I liked it or disliked it.

This is a very well done film showing the life of international students during their `` Erasmus year '' in their home country. The film is also an eye opener in terms of the lack of education of students about their rights and their responsibilities. In many ways the movie is an eye-opener in terms of the students` attitude towards life and their attitude towards their future. This is very well made and thought-out film and it is a must watch by all the students to get the true meaning behind Erasmus. This film also has an interesting message in terms of the attitude towards life and what we do with our lives.

Having read all of the comments on this film I am still amazed at Fox 's reluctance to release a sequel. I think the problem is that Fox didn't realize they couldn't sell a movie that was made on a shoe-in. If that is the case then we are all doomed to a sequel for all the good films that didn't get made. What they should be doing is making two films back to back. The first one should take place 20 years after the events of the first film and the second 20 years after that and they would have a trilogy.

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years. Great production design, appealing stars, great lines ("Miss Bender, I don't care if you beat it out on a native drum! ", says Joan Crawford's Amanda Farrow to Hope Lange when Lange incredulously asks how she is expected to read a summarize a large amount of manuscripts in a very short time). If you've seen this movie panned and scanned on TV and not in the letterboxed version on pay-TV or AMC (American Movie Classics) you haven't really seen it.

Watching The Wagonmaster is not likely to result in deep thoughts, unlike many other great Ford films, like The Searchers, My Darling Clementine, The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance, and The Grapes of Wrath among others, but it is likely to produce a feeling of awe and deep satisfaction. The story is very simple: two cowboys decide to help a wagon train of Mormons get to California. Along the way, they run into a medicine man whose mules ran away, a group of bank robbers, and some Navajos.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title . It draws parallels between the attitudes and the actions of US president Richard Nixon and former president Bill Clinton . And the movie focuses heavily on the US government's decision to not prosecute Nixon for Watergate . There are also parallels between the American and Israeli governments, particularly the American Jewish lobby in Israel and the influence that the US and Israel has on the American government . And there are parallels with the rise of Islamic terrorism and its connection with the Arab countries .

This is a luminously photographed and unusually well-written western by veteran creator of "Rawhide" Charles Marquis Warren. Direcxtor Gordon Douglas is its chief help in this regard. Its strong plot line can be told in a few sentences. A hard-nosed by-the- book, Cavalry officer, Captain Richard Lance, captures a leader of the Indian enemy after a massacre at a fort. He insists on bringing the man back for trial, to be sent toTucson; his commander sends another man to try to take the prisoner for trial and the patrol is wiped out.

After seeing Meredith in "Beyond the Prairie" I had to buy another film with her staring. I cannot believe how she let herself into this teenage flick. It's worth it at any price, this one needs to pay you to see. This pretty lady needs someone to put her into a script that can use both her talent as an actress and her beauty as a woman.

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about. Or, maybe it isn't: Herzog goes to the Sahara desert and nearby villages to film assorted landscapes and the locals. But this is just the broadest stroke. It's a feat that you either surrender yourself to, or you don't. He gets into the form of the world around him entirely, without a story, bound only to certain aspects of written poetry, as his camera (shooting on supposedly discarded film stock) wanders like in a pure travelogue.

Both Jackie and Candice are terrific in this movie . They are well-suited to their roles and have several chances to shine . Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic `` Alive '' , there was another young man in a very similar predicament. In 1989, in the middle of the first Gulf War, Tom Cruise, fresh out of college, joined the army. After two years of basic training at Fort Gordon in Georgia, Cruise was shipped off to Iraq to become an army paratrooper. His fellow soldiers thought him a bit of a joke. He was just 18. But the paratroopers of the 101st airborne division had their own plans for Cruise.

Renee Zellweger absolutely shines as Nurse Betty , easily one of the most charming , off-beat , and lighthearted comedies ever to hit the silver screen! ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt get in a relationship in the Army, because you‚Äôre either in love with one person and there‚Äôs no room for anyone else, or you love one person and it is over. The best you can do is to make out with someone, which is not very nice, but if you‚Äôre honest with yourself, you find something.

Me and my roommate got free tickets for a Pre Screening I guess you would call it in Atlanta , Georgia, we were just there for a day and it was amazing, I was so excited because I had seen some of the films from the show in London before but they had not been on here so I was hoping they would be as good as the other ones were. I'll be brief: I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this one that just draws me in and won't let me go. Granted, there are some major flaws in it (some of the acting is below par at best and the dialogue is sometimes so poor it's funny) but there are enough redeeming features to make it watchable to the end.But what are they? Well, it's got a cool little plot - by no means is it original, but it is better presented than other films of its kind.

I 'm not the biggest fan of westerns . My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven , and Tombstone . Both are films that would make my top ten list of movies of all time . Unforgiven is the true tale of an outlaw in 1881 , while Tombstone focuses on an old west lawman ( John Ford ) in 1881 . So I think it's interesting to compare them . I'm a big fan of westerns . It doesn't really matter which one I prefer , as there are a great number of great westerns , both good and bad .

Pity the poor reviewer who disliked / didn't understand this wonderful film. What a sad life he must lead!This movie has more to say about life and relationships than most I've ever seen, yet it's not dark or preachy like the "ordinary people" type of film. It is mostly humorous, though not technically a comedy.The whole thing feels a little like a fantasy, perhaps Shakespear's "Midsummer Nights' Dream."
