A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn to live together in an apartment in Barcelona, where they are all studying on international fellowships. Central to the story is Xavier ( Romain Duris),who may have lived a rather conventional life with his mother in France, but who quickly becomes a leader in the group, helping them deal with landlords and other problems. He learns about life and love rapidly. Duris has a wholesome appearance and gives a fine performance. The rest of the cast also play well.

That's a bad, raunchy, predictable, tacky, salacious soap opera? "The Best of Everything" is just such a guilty pleasure for me, something along the lines of "Valley of the Dolls". I mean, "Best" has everything. Somebody gets pregnant out of wedlock (when's the last time you heard THAT phrase? ), there are affairs everywhere, drinking, backstabbing, jealousy, and even a tragic but not altogether unexpected death.Caroline Bender (Hope Lange) and Mike Rice (the delicious Stephen Boyd) are the centerpieces of the goings-on.

Yes , this is one of the better done television movies and I would n't expect less from Joe Sargent and his production company. I'm a fan of this movie but I wasn't expecting to be blown away by it and I think this is my favorite. There are not a million characters in the movie but Sargent manages to get the most important ones. There are very few actors to take center stage but they do have that. The movie has an amazing amount of atmosphere and it is hard to describe. The plot is fairly standard but it still works.

This Aussie flick filmed in 1999 does an OK job of portraying a bunch of small-time crooks in Kings Cross, Melbourne, Australia. Though it's just a little rough around the edges, it's still good fun, with lots of characters that are easily recognized. You get the sense, though, that some of the characters would be better suited for the back pages of a comic book or a short story collection. The basic premise is that there is a drug ring running in Kings Cross, with the two primary drug dealers at its center.

Do n't watch this movie expecting the Jane Austen wit , crisp dialog or clever social commentary . This time , we go out on a romantic date. The movie opens with a voiceover from Jane. She's on a plane and the voiceover says:

"'You don't have to be an artist to be an artist. You just have to look at the world. And not judge it by the rules of the game you are playing, you know. If you can only see beauty where it lies, then that's the beauty, and you are an artist.'

I think the problem with this show not getting the respect it truly deserves is that it comes after Seinfeld,after ELR and after Friends. Those three sitcoms were the star shows of their time.KOQs came at the end of this special time in TV. But don't let that dissuade you.King of Queens is as good if not better than two of the three mentioned.Seinfeld started it all and was and is a timeless classic. I never laughed so hard than I did at Seinfeld. But KOQs comes real close.When it comes to laughing, I have to rate KOQs second only to Seinfeld.

In a time of bad , if not plain awful , comedies , King of Queens is more than just your average comedy . There's a lot of fun to be had with this comedy , and even if it has a few clunky moments , they're the kind of moments that make the film more enjoyable than you think they'd be . That's especially true if you come out of the film having laughed along with every scene . If you haven't seen it , you'd be better off not seeing this comedy .

Well.....I wouldn't want to lecture anybody but I do feel the urge to say some things I consider important about this BEAUTIFUL film. I saw it for the first time in 1976 (I was 14) and then one more time a year later. That was it. The rest of it was the pink LP of Elton John's soundtrack getting the music and the story deeper and deeper inside my heart. How deep? A week ago my cousin gave me a VHS copy as a present. (No DVD's yet). Boy....was I surprised!!

Neil LaBute takes a dramatic turn from his first two films , In The Company of Men & Your Friends and In a Mirror, My Lord , in In A Mirror, I Am a Killer. It was one thing to make an anti-war film , In The Company of Men (1996) but quite another to do so when you were a war-weary citizen living in Chicago. LaBute had been writing and producing plays and writing for television before making this film. He had also acted and directed television in the early nineties .

I saw this movie when it was first released and thoroughly enjoyed it . What a movie . I am so happy that this movie was made into a movie . It makes you think of a movie that you love . It made me think of some other movies . So if you have not seen this movie and would love to know the ending of the movie you must read the next paragraph. When the movie ends you will remember what you saw and what it meant to you . And it will make your day because you will know the ending .

I absolutely fell in love with this girls. let me tell you something: I am from Romania and here is only the sixth series running bunt every other day that is on USA TV I check the internet and download it from there, so i am in line with the rest of the world. I can not believe how deep I am in this show. I become to know absolutely everything about them I looked on the internet what's Rory's car what are their middle names and stuff like that: Rory is also Leigh and Lorelay is Victoria.

Having just watched this with my mother ( Who got it for Christmas ) i was thrilled to find something I can put on when I go to bed so that at 4am I won't need an alarm. The book is really good but there are some things that I would not have been able to come up with. However this has made me wonder what else I have missed out. So here are some of things I want to read in the future. This is really good as far as I am concerned because I can read the whole book at one go so it has a lot more of my attention.

In Crystal City, a group of Mormons hire the horse traders Travis (Ben Johnson) and Sandy (Harry Carey Jr.) as wagon masters to lead their caravan to San Juan River. Along the journey, they meet first the broken wagon without water of the quack Dr. A. Locksley Hall (Alan Mowbray) and the prostitutes Denver (Joanne Dru) and Fleuretty Phyffe (Ruth Clifford). Then the sadistic outlaws Clegg boys decide to join the Mormon caravan to disguise the patrol leaded by the Sheriff of Crystal City that is chasing them.

Absolutely , I agree with my previous commentator in describing this as a riveting , fascinating and certainly beautiful film. What I don‚Äôt share with my previous commentator is his desire for a repeat viewing of the film. What I would like to say is that I cannot recommend this movie to anyone, including those people who are familiar with it. As far as I am concerned it is the best film ever made. But there are some flaws with this film. It is the type of movie that most people are familiar with in Hollywood and this is the main reason why they enjoy it so much .

The best bit in the film was when Alan pulled down her knickers and ran the cut throat razor over her bum cheeks and around her bum hole. It was also brilliant to see Alan's bum going up and down like a fiddler's elbow later on in the film.Alan was tough as hell in it like when he got annoyed and pushed the four eyed wimp onto the sofa.I've been laughing for days about the cut throat razor bit. A brilliant idea by the script writers. Alan must be brought back into Eastenders so he can do the same to Peggy.Alan is back, and this time he's armed with a razor.

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are bound for a valley where they can settle and live in peace. The scenes of the corral in the town where Ward Bond and Ben Johnson negotiate prices, and Bond introduces the idea of them (Johnson and his partner played by Harry Carey Jr.) leading the train to this valley, are some of the best in the film, as Johnson, a real cowboy, whittles a piece of wood while he banters with Bond.

My family and I normally do not watch local movies for the simple reason that they are poorly made , over budget , poorly scripted , overly acted and badly acted . this is the case with the movies I saw in our local theatre this past week , but it is also the case with the movies you are about to watch . in fact , I know of no better case for this kind of film than this one , as it shows once again that the only good film you'll see on television is the one starring Gene Hackman , Warren Beatty and Anthony Hopkins .

This film blew me away. I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot. After watching this, I see I knew nothing. The story is told through the relationship between the attorney and the black inmate. Both the personal story of these two men and the unfolding courtroom drama were riveting. The flashback sequences in the prison were awesome. It's hard to believe it wasn't documentary footage it was so real. It was not only a great piece of drama, it was an incredible lesson in an important chapter in American history. I'm with Ebert and Roeper.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title. It draws parallels between the attitudes of this country in the face of war and a kind of Hollywood-like falseness that glorifies things that shouldn't be glorified. I'm not sure I agree with the filmmaker's take on recent events (although, truthfully, I can't always tell exactly where he stands) but I admire the unusual and artistic way of getting the point across. Audio tracks of speeches, radio interviews, poetry etc. play as large a role here as visuals.

This was an excellent show . It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron (who died last year) saying how it was one of only two or three PBS shows that she loved. I'm guessing it was another one of them. I'd like to offer a couple of observations:

1) In my experience the PBS schedule is very, very good. I have seen almost every program shown on PBS and I have only seen one or two that I thought were bad. There was nothing that I thought wasn't quite good.

My kids loved this movie . we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie . we got so many good points out of this movie but one thing that i will always remember about this movie is my kids loved it so much that when i would put on a different version of it to show them we would have the same thing happen . it really was very cool . This is definitely a movie for everyone. It is so funny and I'm glad that I'm still alive to watch it. My son loves it, and my little girl LOVED it.

Onstage John Osborne's adaptation of "Picture of Dorian Gray" is a fine tribute to Oscar Wilde's talents as both novelist and playwright.On screen with some editing it becomes a bit sloppy due to the cutting of 3 crucial scenes from the play (one being an important scene between Basil and Henry showing that time has passed. )The acting however is brilliant. Sir john Gielgud return's to his Wilde roots as lord Henry,and although about a decade too old for the role,he totally becomes the enigmatic,life loving cad and cynic that Wilde brought to life so meticulously in his novella.

I thought I was wasting my precious 50 bucks going to watch this movie. But at the earnest request of my friend who is an ardent fan of Aparna Sen, I decided to turn up for the movie. Going at this cheap theater really bothered me, cos I had seen King Kong for 50 bucks at one of the best theatres in town. Anywasy the movie starts of and surprisingly I wasn't complaining. A great story and some really wonderful wonderful acting on Shabana Azmi and Konkona Sen Sharma's part. Shabana Azmi a divorc√©e who has dedicated her life to the well being of her mother and step sister.

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years, Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries of cinema perhaps more so than any other commercial filmmaker. I've been acquainted with Herzog for a few decades now and I've never not been impressed by both the man and his work. Last year I went to see Rescue Dawn and was somewhat surprised at how relatively mainstream the film was, yet couldn't help but imagine Herzog taking his actors and crew into the actual jungle to not only make the film, but to live it.

I lack cable-vision and no longer have "DirecTV". So being a rural resident I have to wait for DVD releases. Being a lover of blondes but not blonds, I of course not only have "Barb Wire", but I have "Stripperella: The Complete First Season". I've not yet found "VIP" or a second season for Stripperella. I have the "Baywatch Hawaiian Wedding" DVD. I have the issues of "Playboy" that Pamela Denise Anderson posed in. I could go on. I love Pamela!

The four signs on the road say `` If You 're Looking For Fun ..... You Do n't Need A Ticket ' ' ''

There are no signs on the roads saying if you don't have a ticket you won't get hurt, but you should be cautious. There are four ways to get a ticket:

- Pay with a ticket- Pay with a non-ticketed item- Use an unlicensed service or business- Use a non-motorized means of travel

- Pay by check

As a person who loves to travel - I will always be careful to ensure that I have a ticket to ride.

This movie was awesome , if you want a movie with non-stop puns and laughter then this is right for you . The movie was funny , i loved this movie and my friend loved it too . It was full of humour , love , sex , comedy and some romance . It was amazing . If u want to watch it with ur girl then u have to see it with her because it is really nice . If u want a good movie , u should watch this one

I have read many reviews on this movie and it is really a great movie.

Surprisingly good made for T.V . Thriller . I was n't expecting too much from this one but I 'm happy I got to watch it. The first part I was a bit disappointed because the story is a bit boring, but by the end, I found it really interesting and a bit creepy. I would recommend the whole series to people who are looking for an original horror. This is definitely my favorite series on Netflix. This is just a very good movie, even if it wasn't original. It's very interesting to see how they made it look so weird.

Cant believe it.... after all these years finally tracked this down.. it was meant to be named 'The Great Pretender' at production stage. I was living in Oz at time and through a friend was looking after one of the house locations through filming.... It was me that showed these guys how to speak Scottish and after all this time, I only realise now one was Russell Crowe !!! It has taken me all these years to track this down, was even unsure if it ever went to screen as I left Oz the following month after wrap up party.

On watching this film, I was amazed at how media perception can mould a persons opinion of a celebrity. Karen Carpenter was a carefree, but very unconfident young lady, whose wonderful voice helped her and her brother Richard to soar the charts with wonderful songs. As with all celebrities of today, they were often criticised about their music as well as their looks, styles, etc. THis had a huge effect on Karen who raged a battle against her eating and drastically lost weight, which eventually caused her death. This heart felt film was not initially something which I would have thought of watching.

wow ! i just have to say this show is super cool ! i fell in love with the show from the first episode ! this is a super fun show ! for real ! it‚Äôs fun to watch because i really enjoy the music and i think that it‚Äôs super creative. i‚Äôve seen one episode where all the girls are running around in circles, singing songs. it makes me think of being a kid, i‚Äôve been watching this show for many years, but i always loved this one because there‚Äôs a bunch of cool stuff going on in this show.

If there's one cartoon that helped to put UPA on the map more than any other, It's Gerald McBoing-Boing. This tale of a little boy who only speaks in sound effects has kept its charm for the last 57 years. Besides the effects, loved the music, the abstract animation and backgrounds, the narration by Marvin Miller, pretty much everything. And it won the Oscar for Best Animated Short of 1950. Glad to have seen it on YouTube after reading about this Dr. Seuss story for so many years. And Rocky and Bullwinkle creator Bill Scott also contributed, how awesome!

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south. The story follows a man named Lazarus whose wife dumps him for his brother and finds Rae abandoned and beaten up on the side of the road. Lazarus finds out that Rae is a sex addict and was abused as a child so he decides to take matters into his own hands by tying up Rae with a chain to cure her of her wickedness. Samuel L Jackson and Christina Ricci have great chemistry together and their performances make you believe that through their struggles and search for redemption that Lazarus and Rae become best friends.

Kane is a killer named Jacob Goodnight , he lives in this burned down old hotel , where eight teen goons terrorize a bunch of helpless college girls. It‚Äôs easy to tell he killed them in cold blood. He seems to be just as ruthless as them. But he isn‚Äôt just a killer; he‚Äôs a survivor. A survivor? In a hotel? This is more than a mere coincidence. There‚Äôs something strange about Jacob Goodnight , something he has been hiding from everyone. He claims to have no memory of his life before he woke up at the old hotel.

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am. My brother and I were channel surfing and who do we see but a young Russel Crowe. But not the telephone throwing Russel Crowe we had come to know and quasi-love back in the states. This movie, much to my surprise, was amazingly creative and hilarious. It stars a cast of awkward teens with hilarious stories of odd sexual experiences, including a slick salesman,prostitutes, and an unusual sexy mother. If you are lucky enough to come across this film I would strongly suggest picking it up.

This is a better-than-average entry in the Saint series - It holds your interest and , as mysteries should , it is well-paced and keeps the mystery alive from the beginning to the end. I thought it was a well done story and would recommend it to mystery readers with any level of experience. What I enjoyed most is the mystery of who is the murderer, and how it is done, because there is so much speculation in the book. I would have preferred a little more explanation and less speculation, because that would have ruined my enjoyment a little.

The Karen Carpenter Story shows a little more about singer Karen Carpenter 's complex life . Though it fails in its promise to shed light on how a songbird from a rural background became a multi-million dollar pop star, ‚ÄúKaren‚Äôs Karen‚Äù is an affecting film that proves that anyone can be someone's dream girl, if he or she tries. In the summer of 1967, when young Karen Carpenter was 16 years old, she arrived at an audition for a part in a television variety show. The show‚Äôs producer, however, didn‚Äôt see her potential.

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin . There are n't much left when the train pulls into the sidings outside the western part of the capital. And that is one of the reasons why a group of passengers decided to walk to the border from where they could cross it with a ticket bought at the train. It was a beautiful sunny day, not a sign of winter at that time, when the train reached the border and the passengers began to gather around the ticket office, with the intention of taking the first chance of getting a valid visa.

Hands down , the best drama/comedy show on television . A cleverly written show about a young mother and her two daughters and the trials of their daily lives . This show is a work of genius . The acting is outstanding , the writing is top notch and the plots are full of surprises . I loved every minute of this show , and can't wait to see what's next. A very good show. It was fun to watch and laugh and it made me think of what it's like to go through what the women in the story are going through.

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award . The film was made in 2004 but did not make the festival circuit, but did get picked up by a distributor and was going to be distributed to theaters around the country.. The film won the best film, best music video, best original score, best short film and best sound editing awards at the festival. I was so glad I saw it on opening weekend. I had read the script by the director, Mark L. Smith at the time.

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school football game in his hometown to get his act together. On a hot summer‚Äôs day in California, when he‚Äôll be forced to play on the other side of the country in California, Ryan is determined to make it in a hostile environment with his teammates. Unfortunately, his teammates have a way of turning the heat up on him as soon as the game begins. A few years back, I read a young adult book with a very cool twist.

POSSIBLE SPOILERSNo one is likely to pick up a DVD of Red Dust without knowing that it is about South Africa's Truth and Reconciliation Commission. Hilary Swank stars as a South African exile who returns to her home town as a lawyer representing Alex Mpondo (Chiwetel Ejiofer), a member of the South African parliament who was tortured by a prison guard, Pete Muller (Ian Roberts), who is seeking to escape prison by testifying before the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. They could certainly have found an actress who has or could imitate a South African accent; Ms. Swank makes no attempt whatsoever to cover her unmistakably American accent.

I could n't believe the eye candy from start to finish . Being a fan of movies directed by music video directors , I can't think of another movie with a more beautiful soundtrack . This is easily one of my favorite movies in recent memory and it's the perfect movie for anyone who is into music videos, or anyone who loves movies that look a lot like music videos . This soundtrack alone would have me buying a copy of the original movie . The film itself is an excellent story about a music video artist and his struggles to make it in the music video business .

Gosh, I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again 20 years later you gain a different view -- primarily because in 20 years you learn more. For example, I had no idea who George Cukor was - how great of a director he was and how much of that made this film fly. All I can say is..I really liked this film for it touched on an area that paralleled my life: lifelong friendship between two women. Can that EVER exist?

This film is remarkable in how unremarkable it is . This is the true story of one woman and one small town, where she became a local celebrity for the crime she committed against the community. As with all true stories there are many twists and turns along the way. A woman is killed in a small town that is run by the local mayor. People blame her for the death. The local paper blames her for causing the death. The local police blame her for letting the man get the best of her.

King of Queens is comic genius . Kevin James , whom plays IPS deliveryman Doug Heffernan is extremely funny , a man of simple words with a simple mind that has a sharp wit. I have seen a lot of stand up shows. I find Kevin James to be the best because he can be serious and make fun of anyone at anytime. In his show I found some of his jokes to be very effective. In my opinion there are very few stand up comics today that can be as funny as James . He is one of my favorites . The story line was also good.

spoiler--In 1993, African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City with "Posse". The film was co-written and directed by Van Peebles, who also stars as the main character, Jessie Lee.Plot: The film begins at the turn of the 20th century, when the United States was embroiled in the Spanish-American war. Apparently a time when the U.S. justice system could send convicts into military service, Jessie Lee finds himself an unwilling enlisted man, serving with an all-black cavalry troop in Cuba.

comeundone, I love you! I could not have come to a better conclusion than you did about this movie and it's ending. My family has not seen this movie yet, but I know them too well; they will hate it. But this time, I watched it alone and I found that it affected me greatly. Although the movie is long in length, I was tied to the story and amazed by the ending. I initially thought it was weird as to how she just vanished, but on some level, it makes perfect sense.But like comeundone said, this movie does not make sense of reality.

This is a film that is far more enjoyable than its rating of 7 would suggest. In many ways, it's like a 50s version of VALLEY OF THE DOLLS--with much of the excesses and sleaziness of VALLEY polished up a bit for the audiences of 1959. Like this later film, both are about three young ladies who are on the fast-track to success--though this time it's in the publishing world instead of the entertainment industry (though one of the ladies in THE BEST OF EVERYTHING does have aspirations of Broadway).The film begins with Hope Lange coming into the company for her first day of work.

This movie just might make you cooooo . The film was WELL worth the dark trip to town . Betty Friedan's book has been the book for me since I was 5. I remember the way my mom told us to never read the book. "Why would you read this book. It's all bad. And if you do read it you will be worse off for having read it." That's when my mother told us we could never read this book . The book was the start of a nightmare in our life for the next 30 years or so.

It has been recorded that John Ford made the "big, blockbuster" movies so that he could afford to make the "small" movies that he loved so well. Wagon Master, with a young Ben Johnson, is clearly one of his best, if not the best of his small movies. The location shooting, the wagons, the intricate work with horses, and the inclusion of the plains Indian are all trade marks of Ford. As in many of his other films, Eisenstein, the great Russian director's influence is seen in this film.

This 1959 soap opera film takes us into the lives and loves of three young women in the publishing world of New York City. The film follows the ups and downs of the career and personal lives of three young women who live and work as book publishers. The film explores the highs and lows of marriage and divorce. It is an emotional film about love and family. This film has been described as a ‚Äòtouching study of a group of women whose stories are told on the screen for the benefit of others.‚Äô

Synopsis

A group of women with careers in publishing, whose lives are intersected by their friendships.

This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made ..... Realistic . Movies were not candy for the eyes in those days ..... Thats why most movies were boring and the audience lost interest to it . Movies are a reflection of the society and people who are alive and living in that time . The movie is a good piece of story and it has a great plot . But i would say that the ending was not good . i would like to hear the opinions from everyone about the movie . I will say this. This movie was not only based on a true story.

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster (a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV's "Land of the Lost") creates a computerized watchdog called C.H.O.M.P.S. (an acronym for Canine Home Protection System) for his boss Mr. Ralph Norton (nicely played by Conrad Baain), whose home security business is floundering. A rival company hires a pair of inept criminals to get their grubby hands on C.H.O.M.P.S. ; said task proves to be easier said than done. Director Don Chaffey relates the endearingly dopey story at a constant brisk pace, maintains an amiably silly and lighthearted tone throughout, and stages the goofy slapstick gags with considerable flair.

One of the many backwoods horror's that came out in the early eightes and fortunately this is one of the better ones. Yes it has a cheesy plot but I was pleasantly surprised at this film, because I thought it was really good and really entertaining, although the killer could have been made a bit more scarier he just looked like a fat slob.First of all, we have the local sheriff or whatever the hell he is, who warns them not to go to those mountains as they are very dangerous. But when the teens arrive, it doesn't seem very dangerous at all, well according to me anyway.

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in Bogot√°, you can feel the total meaning of the word "Bluff"(although is a Colombian film, the title is in presented in English); ! The story is about Nicolas Andrade (Federico Lorusso), a photographer who find his girlfriend Margarita (Catalina Aristizabal) having an affair with his boss Pablo Mallarino (Victor Mallarino), owner of a magazine; after this Nicolas is left without girlfriend and without any job.

I have been a `` huge '' rush fan ever since `` moving pictures '' and this concert is simply awesome! This concert will make you realize why I have been so thrilled to live here in California and I have loved it. The city of Berkeley is the place to live for it is the most interesting, artistic and tolerant city that I have seen in a few years. So many people come from all around to enjoy a good performance here. It just goes to show how wonderful the city of Berkeley is! I hope to see you all there!

This movie was so cool! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends. While the first credits were rolling, we saw that Lionsgate Films had made this movie. They are the ones that made that stupid movie Wolf Creek, which was totally gay! When we saw this, we groaned. We thought it was going to be like Wolf Creek, but we were so wrong! The movie was not only better than Wolf Creek (which really isn't that hard) it is one of the best horror movies I have seen in a long time!

Ignore the bad reviews on here , this film is awesome ! `` Just Before Dawn '' is a great movie that should have been a great commercial success , but in the end, was not . The acting is superb , the story is great and the film is worth your time . It has the right mixture of action , suspense , and romance . I would recommend it to you and it would give you hours of enjoyment . In my opinion , it is a must see movie . If you haven''t seen ``Just Before Dawn '' in theaters yet, then get your tickets as soon as you can .

Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic "Alive", there already was the legendary Mexican exploitation director Ren√© Cardona who used the same drama as an outline for his ambitious film "Supervivientes de los Andes". The unforgettable fatal flight of Fairchild 571 that crashed in the Argentinian Andes on October 13, 1972. This terrible accident cost the lives of many passengers, most of them members of a professional rugby team. But 16 people of them were eventually rescued thanks to their strong will to survive and because they fed on the mortal remains of their unfortunate fellow-passengers.

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about . Or , maybe I've told myself it's nothing to try to tell someone what Fata Morgana is. Fata Morgana is a beautiful thing. It's a place of wonder in a very beautiful world. A place where the stars still twinkle, the moon still glows and the wind is still sweet. But sometimes it's not all that beautiful. There are the people who don't really know what is going on. The people who think they know, but they don't.

There's a brand new killer on the loose, and he's doing God's work. Yeah right! This killer makes Jason Voorhes look like a chump, and Freddy Krueger look like a rag doll against this dude. He is Jacob Goodnight(WWE's Glen "KANE" Jacobs), a 7' monster who wields a Axe, and a hook and chain. Those weapons are nothing to him his real finisher is ripping out eyeballs from the victims sockets. That is totally methodical! When the encounter happened 4 years earlier, Jacob killed a rookie cop and maimed the veteran after putting a bullet in his head.

If this is not my favorite movie of all time , it definitely is in the top five . I really wanted to love it but it was not for me , it was not what I expected and I was not impressed by any of the characters . But the film did have a lot of things about it I liked and some that I did not . I was also disappointed with the ending of the film , I really wanted to end on a positive note but the ending of the film , in my opinion , was one of the weakest parts of the movie .

The entire series , not just The Blue Planet , is nothing short of amazing . The best nature series out there in its class. . . and it‚Äôs even available on Amazon , which is where I‚Äôm putting all my money for books . You have to be a fan of the TV series or the movies to truly love this book . You have to have an appreciation for the beauty of Planet Earth , for the majesty of the seas and mountains . You have to have a sense of awe for the world .

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster ( a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV 's `` Land of the Lost '' ) says he believes he'll win a $ 1 million jackpot playing Texas Holdem. The only problem? He says he's been a little too eager. He hasn't put any of his chips into the pot yet. It's the latest in a line of brain-teasing riddles in the `` Land of the Lost'' syndicated game show. One question, for instance, posed by host Larry Hagman of ABC's `` Dallas '': `` Who would win a fight between Muhammad Ali and George Foreman?

Jimmy ( Heath Ledger ) is given a simple job by Pando ( Bryan Brown ) a underworld kingpin to find the man responsible for a string of recent deaths, but in order to do this, he must discover the identity of the serial killer. The only problem is that there are too many people willing to tell him, and he soon begins to realize the truth of the matter. He soon finds himself being pulled in many directions in a race against time and the police, all the while being hunted by a dangerous and cunning killer who has never been seen in public.

I've been waiting almost 25 years to see this hard to find horror thriller and I finally did since it's proper rebirth on DVD. Of course it didn't have the same impact on me as it would have if I had seen in it the 80s, but director Lieberman (his film "Squirm" is excellent) makes good use of the lovely Oregon location and takes the time to develop the characters, not just to have them dispatched in creative ways. A high note, Brad Fiedel's whistling music is really creepy and adds to the desolate proceedings making this great fun for genre fans.

Up And Coming was a very positive sitcom , which brought a tool/and or channel that opened the young minds, but also opened the mind of the audience. It was funny , exciting, a lot of potential to develop and bring to the next step and it did. The characters and their storyline were a lot of comedy , but they also could be serious and it was a story that could be followed and it was very exciting. The show went to air in 2007 and I was only 16 when i watched that first episode but i was so excited i could hardly sit down to watch it.

As a European , the movie is a nice throwback to my time as a student in the 1980 's when I was able to go on holiday to various parts of Europe. It was a trip that taught me that Europe is very, very different from the USA. That is, I have friends who will tell me stories of the differences. The European way. But for the sake of this story, let‚Äôs go to the movies and see what the world really is like... I had the opportunity to see a movie a couple of months ago.

10 respected directors each shot a short film with operatic arias as the inspiration (and music). I'll do each one separately:Nicolas Roeg (dir)--Giuseppe Verdi (music). A story about an assassination attempt in 1931 Vienna. Theresa Russell (Roegs wife) plays a man! Not bad--very beautiful and exotic. Russell is great.Charles Sturridge--Verdi. No story but there is some haunting black and white imagery that fits perfectly with the music.Jean-Luc Godard--Jean Baptiste Lully. Horrendous. Pointless, boring, no plot, no nothing.

`` The Honkers '' is probably Slim Pickens best performance of all time . When we were shooting , everyone was talking about it. We were just shooting , and I think the movie is as good today as it was then , and even today is better than it was then , because of how much we worked in editing . But I did not realize how much people were enjoying the movie at the time . And it was my first film in color , and that is not an easy thing to do because I don't think anyone in America had seen color films in color at the time . ''

15 Park Avenue , well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in the city. As the story unfolds it becomes a story about the people on the street, and the film takes us inside that world, exploring all of its intricacies. At the core, there are two separate stories, but they are linked and intertwining, as are the lives of the three men who inhabit it ‚Äì a group of brothers who have made a pact to survive and build a life without the outside influences that have taken over their childhoods.

After I 've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this film. I believe the reason is that it was a great film in the first place, and when you take a step back and analyse the film from a different perspective you can start to appreciate it much more. I found this film so very moving. I had seen this film the previous year, and when I saw this version of it, my heart went out to this man, as I thought about what he would be going through.

The first time I saw `` Alice in Wonderland ¬ñ an X-rated Musical Comedy '' , was in the early 70¬ís and was amazed at how it was written by a single person and performed by a single actor. It was created and performed by Bob Carroll , who was also one half of the group that recorded the original version, `` Alice in Wonderland ¬ñ an Uncut Version . "" Bob Carroll was born on August 28, 1938 in New Jersey. His parents lived in Florida when they met. His mother was a singer.

Loved the shots of airports -- Dallas, Phoenix, Fresno, etc., just single buildings with the name in block letters on the roof. And the tri-motors, and the well-dressed passengers. Fast-forward 75 years....But what really got to me was the hammer and sickle emblem and what appeared to be a Chinese ideogram adjacent the logo, aft of the pilot's seat on the starboard side of the fuselage. Remember when the mutual acquaintance Neil and Jill encounter says that Jim'd become a general in a Chinese rebel army?

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a lot to learn about our country and life and how things happen and how a person has to deal with it or not. This book is really a good book in the right direction. I really enjoyed reading it but it is not a must read. But a good to keep for the ones who really want to know what life is like in India. I am sure there are lot of new readers who will really enjoy reading this book and would like to know a lot about life in india.

This as the first of the Ma and Pa Kettle flicks. Marjorie Main (Ma) steals the show in anything she does. Funny to see Ida Moore as Emily, the daffy old lady on the train.. god she was ALWAYS old; she was in "Desk Set" and "Alfred Hitchcock Presents". Their new house is also a co-star here -- its the house of the future with some really cool inventions that Pa doesn't care for. LOVE the painting gag. Keep an eye out for TOM... he starred in "Nanny & the Professor".

It 's interesting to watch how late 1950 's society is depicted in this film . Men are lecherous , the wife is selfish , the couple is unhappy . The kids are bored . The parents are at odds . I 'll bet it 's the same in life. Monday, July 16, 2013

Today I decided to watch a '50s movie , and I 'm not going to make a review. Instead, I 'm going to share my thoughts on the movie , and some of my favorite quotes from the movie . I 'll also mention some of the plot points .

Jordan takes us into the seedy crime side of Sydney, Australia, following the desperate attempt of nineteen year old Jimmy, (Heath Ledger), who bundles a job for a local gangster and needs to make amend before they get to him. The gangsters, (led by Bryan Brown), are a menacing bunch with a humorous streak in them. That's what makes the film work, because we always view gangsters as a rough bunch out to screw you badly. But this mob tickle your funny bone as well. A clever structured script by Jordan has characters crossing paths and getting caught in the web plot.

Ok, maybe Posse can't compare to other popular cowboy/western movies. But that's because it didn't have the FUNDING those movies had. Obviously, whenever you want to produce a story such as this one, focusing on African American historical involvement (and NO, servants and 'mammies' are not historical involvement), Hollywood isn't going to be too supportive. And believe me they weren't. The producers and actors sacrificed a lot of 'out of pocket' expenses to make "Posse", just so that the story could be told. I think that alone is commendable.

Bluff I really think this movie is very good.Is basic a different kind of Colombian movie. Is hilarious and the actors uses local expressions that are so much fund to listen.It shows a different face o Bogot√° and I think that's very important because Colombia is a diverse country and we need to show that to the world This is the first movie of the director Felipe Martinez and I really except this movie will be the beginning of a great career as a film director.We need to continue support Colombian filming industry, because this movie and others good films are the beginning of something big.

Obsessed!!!!! I have every season of Gilmore Girls and I think the reason I love it so much is because of how smart the script is, its not your average comedy show there isn't any pause after a joke it just keeps on, if you missed you missed it. And its not like a soap opera drama either because it doesn't use dramatic music and the actors never have those stupid cheesy surprise looks. I think Gilmore Girls is one of the bests shows on T.V. shows of its time.

Robin Hood: Men in Tights (1993) was a much needed parody from Mel Brooks. He has the assignment of spoofing the Robin Hood legacy and the couple of movie dealing with the mythical honorable thief of English folklore. Cary Elwes stars as Robin Hood. He's looking for a few good men who'll join him in his quest to topple the evil sheriff of Nottingham (Roger Rees) and win the fair hand of Maid Marian. Robin also has to deal with Prince John (Richard Lewis).as well.

In the midst of a documentary about his parents, the filmmaker's mother dies, but he continues making the documentary, discovering a story he did not anticipate. The result is an absorbing drama that has the quality of fiction in the best sense of that word, where a likable but unknowing narrator unwittingly privileges the audience. The narrative thus has a double weave, the story of the documentary and the story of the documentary-maker.Our admiration is with the filmmaker, not only for doggedly pursuing his story though it risks his entire notion of his parents' relationship, but also for never giving in to sensationalism or melodrama.

Hands down, the best drama/comedy show on television. A cleverly written show about a young mother and her 16 year old daughter exploring life and finding things out not only about the world but themselves too. Lorelai Gilmore (Lauren Graham) struggles to find a way to remain in close bond with her daughter but steer her in the right path, which through-out the show is becoming harder and harder. Rory Gilmore (Alexis Bledel) caught in a world of books and learning is just beginning to discover boys and her own sense of rebelliousness, which surprises them both.

Alright so this episode makes fun of Al Gore. I'm sure it pisses a few liberals off. The thing is South Park makes fun of everybody, much like the Simpsons did. If you get offended that a politician you like is made fun of then maybe you need a better sense of humor and are taking the show too seriously. With that being said this episode is hilarious and one of the best. Al Gores portrayal is hilarious, Cartman's scheme goes terribly wrong and the results will have you rolling on the floor laughing.

I think that Mario Van Peebles movie Posse is a very important film . It is an excellent entry point into a new way of dealing with issues of racism and stereotyping, that most films have been guilty of. Van Peebles as a black man is very convincing in the roles he plays throughout the film and it gives us a glimpse into other cultures and the way of life that exists there. This is a film that we all need to make sure we get out to see , because it is the first movie that really touches on these issues that we all need to face.

For my money , probably the best film - or at least the most purely cinematic film - director Fordham has ever been. He was the first of his generation to make what has come to be known as the Ford-era documentary , and his first film is something like a proto-documentary in every respect. And the fact is that it is so. Not that he is a particularly great documentary filmmaker, or that he doesn't often have the best ideas in the world, or that he isn't, in his way, the greatest filmmaker in America today.

I got to watch this movie in my french class as part of lets say `` french culture '' . I thought it was funny at the time . But I am not sure if what I saw in my eyes was as funny to others as it was to me as a child. Now that I see it in french, I feel that there is more to say about it. But at the very least , I found this film to be entertaining and I think it was well put together. I would like to see the movie version in english with an english soundtrack and I think it would be even better.

This little picture succeeds where many a big picture fails. Because it was a little picture, John Ford was not harassed by the studio big wigs. He was happier with this film than any other because he was able to do it his way. He was also able to use his repertoire of gifted character actors that had played such an important role in his past successes. Some of them such as Ben Johnson had been discovered by Ford and given opportunity to show their talents. Johnson was recruited by Ford because he was an authentic cowboy from Oklahoma who usually did his own stunt work.

I saw the movie in 1972 , and like other people who have commented on it here ... I went to see it again in the 90's with a friend who is also an expert on movies and who also told me I was wrong in my appraisal of the film back then. Now he says it's one of the best films ever made, a masterpiece. And he's right. I saw it as a kid with my mother and father and sister (who was about 8 at the time) but I have seen it in its entirety multiple times now and it's still one of my favorites.

Gosh , I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again as a mature adult, it's always a good idea to remember where you were at the time, so that you don't miss anything. I'm glad I took this film so much to heart as I've seen it all before, and I can always watch it without thinking twice. I'll be seeing this film at our next trip to see a movie, and I'm looking forward to seeing how this film holds up as I watch it over the next few weeks and months.

The Ma & Pa Kettle characters were highly popular AND controversial. The films that featured their brood paved the way for television sitcoms that came after it and sought to emulate its winning formula. One obvious reference is 'The Beverly Hillbillies,' where the new home was bought with oil money, not having been won in a contest. You could even say the 1980s sitcom 'Newhart' borrows its idea of backwards rural characters from this series. Still, I wonder if Betty Macdonald, the Washington-based author who created these characters, didn't do more harm than good.

there 's only so much that i can take of Filipino films , especially nowadays where the trend is sex , and violence. I don't think the film gets enough credit for having some real depth in it. But, I have to say that it's not very good , I have seen better . But, the scene with the two old men and one of them with his back against a tree is just really sad to watch. __________________
It is better to remain silent and be thought a fool, than to say something and remove all doubt.

I 'd honestly give this movie a solid 7.5 , but I clicked 10 to try to offset the 5 I have for some other reviews. After a couple of days of not being able to read the title , I finally finished it . The story is about how you grow up , and why you grow old , and why life in America is so much more difficult than in other countries , and what you can learn from being old , and how things change , but still stay the same until you die , as well as many other philosophical things.

These cartoon writers are unrelenting with their corny ( and fun ) puns . The first shot we see in the movie is the back of the head and the head of one of the guys in the band . After that , we see the back , front of the head, back, and the head again . This is what you have to expect if you watch this movie . What makes it even more amusing is the fact that they didn't have to change the shot to a cartoon . It could have been any random shot from the movie .

The hurried approach that Lewis Seiler takes with King of the Underworld establishes a deeper plot, while still maintaining an efficient run-time. One of the clearest examples of this is the transition between poverty and wealth for the married medical couple. The audience is instantly transported from a shanty medical office to a luxurious suite at the city's most prestigious inn. This development is critical to understanding the position the doctors have been thrown into. The story suggests from the intro that these two people are generally happy with providing medical practice to those who are less fortunate.

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites. The unsung hero of his generation. Nobody mentions Cukor in the same breath as John Ford, Howard Hawks, William Wyler or Billy Wilder and yet, look at his filmography. From sparkling comedies "The Philadelphia Story" "Adam's Rib" "Holiday" Psycho melodramas "Gaslight" "A Double Life" a great semi western "Heller in Pink Tights" not to mention "My Fair Lady" or "Travels with my Aunt" He was at the service of his actors, he never put himself in front of the camera.

George Cuckor , known as a director of women , could n't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful actresses in his film. As a director, he was at his best when he could use a strong leading woman as a foil or a mirror for his male actors. As a woman , he could use them as a mirror or foil only to the extent his own ego allowed. As in all his films that are not written for men, there is no strong leading lady in this one. It is not the first time when he failed to find one .

I first saw this film in 1959 at the Hoyts Double Bay cinema in Sydney when fifteen years old . A year later I saw it for the first time, again at the Double Bay. From then on it was on every Saturday afternoon at 6.30 p.m. when I was growing up with my dad and brothers and sisters. Every Saturday afternoon my father sat us down and turned on the record player and we watched it together . It was an amazing movie, I‚Äôll never forget it, and then it was taken off the market .

If I 'd only seen the poster for Nurse Betty , I probably would n't have touched it with a ten foot pole ! I know the story is a tad dated now but back then the poster had the poster artist and writer on the cover! The artist had just won the British art contest, but was too poor to pay the full prize money. As a result she won only half the prize, but she wanted the prize money and was determined to have it all! She wrote the story about Nurse Betty as well as the illustration and the poster.

The best of everything. Just what is the best of everything? It is different for everyone but for most of us it is love. But alas not everyone knows where or who to look to for real love. This story goes the whole gambit of looking for love. Sometimes in all the wrong places and for all the wrong reasons. But as the saying goes,"we are the captains of our own ships", and so it goes for our lives. We are responsible for the choices that we make in our lives. Once we make those choices then we must live with them.

Strange enough , shorts like this get a 10 . Why ? They are hilarious . This is hilarious . These are the first time I have seen an episode of Full House that actually had me laughing. I‚Äôm not going to say they are funny , I‚Äôll let the viewers decide. I am going to say that this episode is the funniest in the entire show . It is a comedy episode , it is a funny episode , and it is full of heart . I think that I may actually watch the next episode when it airs .

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college. As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to sexual adventurer, I got to wondering why her sexual encounters seemed familiar. Then I remembered-- Intro Psych 101 Lecture! One of the lectures dealt with the Psycho-Sexual Stages of Developement, basically the shift over time on what part of the body and its attendant stimulations gets our main attention, as well as the changing emphasis on what gives us pleasure. Alice's first encounter is being bathed, with emphasis on the genitals and bottom.

One of the better made for TV biopics , I just wish it had told us more . I have to say I was a bit underwhelmed by it . The performances were decent I think , but it just felt kind of dull in parts . The ending is just about the worst you could possibly get with a biopic . It felt more like a TV pilot than a true film . It didn‚Äôt have any of the depth and richness of a real documentary , but I do understand why it did . If this film had been made a year or two earlier , it could have been amazing .

Susie Q. is one of those rare, and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling. It's bittersweet, but wholesome, and it's characters are fun, and captivating. At first, I thought the movie would be the clich√© cuddly movie that would bore me after five minutes, but was I wrong. It made me tear up at times, and it's plot was enticing, making me root for the good guys. I loved the movie, and still remember it today, 9 years later!!

When this show first came on the air, I saw it once or twice and thought it was another "fat guy, skinny wife" show that seemed to populate the networks at the time. It was just "okay" upon initial viewings and I didn't watch it again; however, once it went into syndication, I caught several episodes (simply because it was on twice a night), and I'm telling you, the more you watch this show, the funnier it is. Once you see how all of the great supporting characters are connected, this show makes you laugh out loud.

This is a simple episode ad so far after watching all of the Season 11 episodes ( with the exception of this one) I can feel that Season 12 will not be so simple as the other 9 seasons. There was just too much complexity to it which makes it even more satisfying to see it through. I liked that Season 11 had a lot of character developments, which were brought to their full development. But now it is time to show that character development in Season 12 and I can definitely say Season 11 was the best episode of Season 12.

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage . I saw this on Netflix and it is worth the watch

I saw a documentary once that I really enjoyed. It was a very good documentary and I enjoyed it. I won't go too in depth about this one because it is a long one. It was about a very interesting subject. It was the story of Jack Kerouac and the story of his wife. I won't go through the entire documentary. It was very good.

Fata Morgana is, by far, one of the weirdest and most perplexing art films I have ever seen. I hesitate to call it a documentary because, while is does have elements of documentation of it's images, the images themselves are so unusual, so hallucinogenic, so unclear, that I wonder whether it was really worth telling this story just so that these images can exist. The film basically is the tale of the earth and the creation of the earth shot from the perspective of an outsider, be it alien or something otherwise indescribable, all taking place in the Sahara desert.

This film was made soon enough after Karen 's passing that perhaps Richard Carpenter and the people closest to Karen would have wanted to get it out there while their grief and sorrow was at its peak before it had to be. I'm glad I saw it. It is very sad that Richard Carpenter lost a dear friend. He had been such a good friend of mine for so many years and I will miss him tremendously. I'm so sorry for the loss of Karen Carpenter. I have never met Richard Carpenter but have seen his movies over the years, and he was always a good person.

Please be aware that this film has nothing to do with the Radio City Music Hall ! The first film I ever went to see was the 1964 version of The Sound of Music.

Finally a true horror movie. This is the first time in years that I had to cover my eyes. I am a horror buff and I recommend this movie but it is quite gory. I am not a big wrestling fan but Kane really pulled the whole monster thing off. I have to admit that I didn't want to see this movie, my 17 year old dragged me to it, but am very glad I did. During and after the movie I was looking over my shoulder. I have to agree with others about the whole remake horror movies enough is enough.

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe. Notice how some of the Roman sets are redressed to pass for Egyptian sets. The film is produced with all first class elements, beautiful photography, stirring soundtrack (Alfred Newman and Bernard Herrmann - see if you can tell which composer scored specific scenes). However, the principal acting is a bit weak. Edmund Purdom seems to have a limited range of emotions and is uninteresting to watch. The best performances come from Peter Ustinov as the one-eyed slave and Polish actress Bella Darvi as the Babylonian temptress "Nefer".

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. I just started watching The Show around July . I found it by mistake , I was channel surfing during my lunch and I accidentally stumbled on the main channel , I thought I should try to watch it .
